string.text: Why exactly is this place called the “flea market”?

Never been to such a place in the Great Land? Let's just say this place is a market, albeit an unusual market. There are no big shot hucksters around here like Sidorovich, only guys that sell what they owe and what they find on the ground! By the way, you can get some nice goods around here at night, and the whole place has also got a nice background to it. A while ago, there were a bunch of guys in the ruins of the building nearby until they were driven off by Dutyers who didn't particularly like the fact that they were trading artifacts. Those bastards didn't care where they got it from or how; only the prices mattered to them! They decided to bring back the past recently, the Duty boys holed up in their bar anyway, and the bandits don't know about this place. The building's inconspicuous and quite cozy... I don't even know where that steel door leads. I joined them later, when my combat skills started to soften up...
I spoke to Noah.
Oh, I forgot about the request. So what does he have there?
They say her name's Lassie. She's got two puppies, and they haven't shown any kind of aggressive behavior.

Puppies? Never thought you'd ever see that in the Zone. Well, thanks. Now I know that there are more friendly pseudodogs breeding in the Zone. Here are a few provisions for your future journeys... and, if you need it, you can have some information about a route between the army warehouses and the Red Forest. It's remained with us like an echo from the past.
“Opening hours: 06:00–20:00”
Are you the stalker who reached the center of the Zone and stayed there for half a year?
Well, not half a year, just over a month. But yeah, name's Mikluha. Nice to meet you.
How was it?
Sorry, but I'd rather not start reminiscing. What matters most is that I got out safe and sound.
Got it. Thanks anyway.
Tell me about this place.
What can I say? This place isn't really the best. Radiation chews you up through the ass, and it's full of freaks like Dutyers and bandits.
And how are the sights?

I guess the flea market here's the main landmark... There's the train hangar north of here. Don't go there, it's chock full of bandits. Further north along the road is the entrance to the Bar, guarded by sentries from Duty. Close by near the road to the Cordon is a substation of some sort, but nobody goes there. It's just a good-for-nothing area full of anomalies. And by the way, we've got three whopping spots full of anomalies in the area, and one of them is, unfortunately, in the substation itself... lots of Electros and shit. The stalkers have chosen these areas and aren't letting anyone pass, although that doesn't matter to the bandits; they haven't come here to hunt artifacts, but rather steal them from those who possess them... which is why they have such a strategic advantage, being located right by the entrance to the Bar. The wildlife here ain't too bad, as long as you stay on the surface and out of the substation. There's a tunnel the railway in the train hangar leads into, and damned if I know what's there... for all I know, not even the bandits have gone there... egh, and I've heard that a certain type of local fauna has gathered there.
Since you're an expert hunter, I'd like to know some more about mutants.

There are a few cute rodents in the Zone, called “tushkanos”. You've seen them for sure. They don't really seem dangerous, but in packs, they can easily kill even an experienced stalker. There was a case where a special detachment of Dutyers went to sweep a bloodsucker lair. Those idiots made camp somewhere in the middle of the Agroprom complex... One of the guys took off somewhere while another screwed around on his PDA. No one was keeping the night watch. Morning came, and no one was there; something was wrong. The first people to enter that room were in for a big surprise... The throats of the squad members had been all chewed up. Typical tushkano traces. God knows why the rodents just up and left their meal. Anyway, the rest of the soldiers decided to head to the lair and finish the job, writing off the deaths of their comrades afterwards. That's how those men perished. Some stalker ended up retrieving their PDAs, having a new story to tell in the Bar for shits and giggles.

Every rookie encounters a few dogs at the Cordon, as well as in the Great Land. They don't really differ that much from their “prototypes”, so to speak... except they're blind, but that doesn't really keep them down, since their other senses have evolved... especially their ability to smell. They can take out newbies like fish in a barrel, and sometimes more experienced stalkers, too, mostly thanks to their maneuverability and sudden strikes. Hey, here's a story for you: somebody made it a habit to snatch some sausage from the Bar. Everyone raised some fuss, tore up the security, and some men from Duty even ended up keeping watch and check who was stealing. Eventually, they saw a dog run in through a hole in the fence and, naturally, shot it down. In the morning, a solemn-looking stalker comes into the Bar and asks about the dog... Barman realizes what's happening and tells him to ask the guys from Duty. Turns out the fresh-faced lad was moving to the Zone with that dead dog, who was his pet. They went though a lot... The guy was also an orphan, and then this happens to him. Ever since that moment, any wise guy who crosses the border into the Zone with a pet either keeps moving or makes dinner out of his “little friend” for other stalkers... just to keep tensions low. By the way, all that sausage was actually stolen by a local alcoholic.

There are dogs, and there are pseudodogs. Why “pseudo”, you ask? Well, they originally evolved from wild wolves. On their own, they are easily dispatched by point blank buckshot rounds, much like ordinary wild dogs. However, a pack of pseudodogs is nothing to scoff at. Moreover, they conjure clones of themselves that swarm you... and when that happens, you need to find and kill the real one for the phantoms to stop appearing, otherwise you end up wasting precious ammo and risk getting yourself badly hurt. Those creatures are very reasonable, though, and there are even legends about, claiming they can be tamed. The Swamp Doctor's pseudodog is an example. You can go find him if you don't believe me.

Let me tell you about snorks. The most common theory is that they're former military personnel who guarded the Chernobyl Nuclear Power Plant before the second explosion, when it completely fried their brains and turned them into abominations. Something like a zombie, only... even more bestial and primitive. Another theory is that they were exposed to some kind of gas prior to their change, which explains why all of them wear gas masks. When the first emission struck, it was powerful enough to vaporize anyone in the vicinity of the power plant in the blink of an eye, even collapsing underground structures, causing the substance to leak out of a secret complex or something. They crawl on all fours, claw, kick, and even pounce fairly long distances to close in on their prey. Just one is dangerous, but a group of them? Might as well off yourself right then and there. If you ever come across snorks, sidestep their pounce, then blast their ass full of lead. Heck, if you're confident, but also have a death wish, you can kill them in midair. Good luck with that.

Zombies. You know those American flicks where zombies just grunt, moan, and attack with their hands? Well, it ain't like that in Zone... sort of. Most zombies here are former stalkers, their brains completely mashed, torn, and battered by the Brain Scorcher. A lot of them still retain their speech and are also capable of operating firearms. It's hard to understand what they're saying most of the time... Many of them are also slaves to a controller that exploits them for various purposes, although rarely, the controller uses his “servants” as food. Sakharov might be able to give you a better understanding. There's also a more barbaric, generic type of zombie, more like the ones you see in movies. They're slow, and not at all capable of using guns, so it should be simple to kill them... just don't let yourself get cornered. They also feign death quite well... shoot them anywhere other than the head, and they'll fall over and wait for your closure. It's best to confirm the kill by shooting them in the head from a distance while they're down, as they emit lots of radiation up close. According to a few documents discovered by the Marked One during his prime years, as well as a few other stalkers, the uniforms some of the more ordinary zombies wear was experimental, suggesting the zombies might've been something more than just working men. It's likely they originate from laboratories and complexes, and there's bound to be more of them located underground, so be wary.

Bloodsuckers, perhaps? Let's see. Rumor has it they're mutated human beings. Whether or not they mutated from the radiation after the explosions or were scientifically modified by other humans, I don't know. What I do know, however, is that they're one of the most dangerous predators inhabiting the Zone. Not only do they boast incredible speed, but they also camouflage themselves, making them extremely dangerous and aggressive beasts. They use stealth and circle around you, tiring your legs out, waiting for the perfect moment to strike; and when they do, it's curtains for you. See, their name speaks for itself. They drain so much blood that by the time you unhinge those slimy feelers off your neck, you might as well be a piece of paper floating in the wind. I've heard stories of a stalker having committed suicide while being circled indefinitely by a bloodsucker. It's almost like a game to them, really. When they're not sucking your blood through a straw, their razor sharp claws come into play. Just like snorks, you can avoid their attacks, but you gotta expect it: be alert, use a shotgun, aim for the head, then fire. Rookies end up with empty mags and often fatal wounds. You'd better find a high spot or stick close to an object, keeping both of your eyes open, because the bastard will appear right before you. Keep your trigger finger on the ready and fire right as the sucker closes in. That's the best tactic if they find you alone... running away from them is problematic.

Burers. They are near-legendary creatures, the existence of which many don't even want to know... Personally, I shit myself with fear just thinking about them. The best advice I can give regarding burers is to not head into dungeons or any kinds of empty complexes, laboratories in particular, because they love dwelling in such places. Recently, though, they have been sighted in pretty much every place in the Zone, and this is primarily thanks to to the actions of the Marked One, who turned off the Brain Scorcher. Chimeras too, for example, used to live closer to the center of the Zone, but then suddenly migrated and increased their population. Apparently, someone who runs all of this in the center of the Zone has got some influence over these creatures and is using them as a kind of Cerberus on the last approaches toward their “stronghold”. If you get into trouble and end up unable to escape, I'd advise you to protect your head, because they've got relatively powerful telekinesis powers. They can fire a focused impulse and knock you off your feet, and also take away your weapons and exhaust you, somehow influencing the gravity around you. They resemble fat, hideous dwarfs, who wear huge shoes with their own characteristic sounds, as well as black cloaks, strangely enough sewn almost their size. I too think that they are the result of experiments in secret laboratories. There are also different subspecies of burers, for example fire and electric, just like poltergeists. Some argue that the poltergeist is an evolutionary stage of the burer... however, if an electric poltergeist acts on you only with telekinesis, then a corresponding burer can easily throw a ball of lightning at you or even a whole Electra anomaly, the size of a substation.

Controllers are no joke: those monsters emit a steady psy-background and can manipulate the consciousness of any person. It's absolutely fatal to approach them without the right type of protection, and you're generally better off staying away from any places they might be dwelling in. They'll most likely just burn your brain out, not even zombifying you, in order to make some juicy grub out of you right then and there. Legend's going around saying that they can even talk, but I don't really believe it... Their high level of intellect is beyond doubt, though. Sometimes they can stage clever ambushes. They often wander alone, greedy for food, or thinking about whatever goes on in that screwed-up head of theirs... A stalker once dropped by and told me and the boys that there was a weird creature that settled down around Rostok. He went to have a look, but was stopped by a sudden, severe headache that almost made him drop his gun. So, he backed off, thinking it was just radiation... The rest of us went with him to scoop the place out, came in; and I also felt a headache! Later, we went back prepared, having taken some special pills that basically got rid of any emotions in our body. I looked around and saw a man-shaped figure sitting in the darkness. I opened fire, but it disappeared, and then, the bastard came out behind my back, and I shot him. Then I heard a faint, yet familiar voice... and couldn't believe it. I had shot down my friend Vasyuk. Eventually we managed to get rid of that mutant freak, but I quit hunting ever since and ended up opening a bar here. I was fortunate not to get killed. Redhead was a smart guy, so he took off to the north after what happened.

And the cats... Have you seen those things? Oh, god. Only this place can turn pets into feral beasts. Their whole thyroid is swollen from all the radiation, along with tumors located inside their cheeks. I don't really know why those cats have become like this. They've grown in size with sharper claws, and they run like crazy. People usually have to get domestic cats down from trees... Here, you're the one who gets chased around. To make matters worse, they've developed a pack mentality similar to dogs and wolves. They're wild and they can be found anywhere in the Zone, so keep an eye on your surroundings at all times. They come running, and if you aren't careful, they will cling onto your ass and have a nice, tasty bite.

Not many people here believe in the paranormal, and everyone has their own faith. Some people believe in their own strength, some believe in their leaders, and some believe in alien intervention... but certainly not in God. However, there is still a monster by the name of “poltergeist”, because how else would you describe a translucent flying abomination that throws objects at you? Still, there's pretty much nothing in common between the mutant and the type of entity in folklore. You can kill it in quite ordinary ways. It doesn't react to salt—we had a poor bastard that tried it—and looks like a flying electric anomaly, or, less commonly, a fire essence. The electric one loves showering you with all sorts of random garbage, just like a burer, but the fire one is somehow able to create a jet of fire right in front of your face, similar in effect to a geyser and extremely hot. Shoot directly into the essence - you won't miss, but it is very difficult to kill because of its speed and maneuverability. In a few cases, stalkers have spotted some kind of black or smoky poltergeist. Nothing certain is known about its properties, but it's quite a rare specimen, and probably so because meeting with it means death in the vast majority of cases. It's even more difficult to kill because of its smoke that's harder to trace. Thus, aiming and shooting at its core is more difficult.

There are also creatures whose tales are told in front of campfires. They are called fractures. Humanoid creatures with hypertrophic arms and necks, they possess an abnormal hand that can break a person's chest, while the other is more often than not normal, without any anomalous property. There are a lot of stories about the fact that Fractures often like to come into contact with stalkers and ask for all kinds of crap, anywhere from cans to imported toothpaste. If you aren't lucky and don't have what it asks of you, then prepare for a fight or a certain death... especially death, because fractures often come into contact during a favorable situation for them; for example, if you are alone and he's already holding you from behind with his bucketed hand. If you do have what it asks of you, don't hand it over rushedly; rather, move away from it quietly and on all fours. That way, you won't get harmed. Anyway, those are all stories... who really knows. Some even leave provisions in places where fractures have been spotted, in vain hopes to drive them off.

Here's another one: the pseudogiant. Usually, its height never exceeds that of a human's... however, its powerful paws can cause very strong shock waves, which is how it earned its name. Until recently, again, nothing about it was known, and it is most likely another of those abominations from the laboratories, thanks to the underground assholes who love to rummage around every single complex and not close any doors behind them. To the north, there was some kind of military guy who never shut the door at some facility... at the Iron Forest in Zaton, I believe. Since then, these giants have been observed even in the vicinity of the Jupiter plant. By observing some of its features, it is possible to determine that “it” was once a man... like the small, hanging arms in front of the main ones, its skin, and a few other peculiar characteristics. It's got some sharp teeth, but don't worry about that, because it's more likely to just knock you down and crush you. And don't take its awkward appearance into account, because it never falls down and never goes astray. The best thing to do before venturing near an area where a pseudogiant has been spotted is to grab a couple of rifle grenades and a machine gun, as the skin and bones of the mutant have shown excellent resistance to small arms, and the creature itself is very resilient.

The chimera can rightfully be considered at the top of the food chain in the Zone. How come? It is a very clever creature: a nocturnal predator that can pounce at you with a single jump from a distance of several tens of meters. Four-legged mutant, has two heads, for which it has received its nickname. It is also very durable and has sharp claws, capable of tearing through even the skin of a pseudogiant. It lets out a characteristic roar while jumping, frighteningly similar to a person's. They've have mainly been encountered in the northern parts of the Zone, in open places near facilities or complexes. As told by local hunter Trapper, they have their own sphere of influence, where they rest and hunt during late at night. There is also a subspecies, namely the black chimera. It cannot be seen at all in the dark, which makes it much more dangerous than its relatives, as the usual ones have almost human skin color. It is also said to be stronger and more enduring... Escaping from a chimera is practically impossible. It's better to find a narrow room that will hamper its maneuverability, or try to jump aside while it leaps at you.

Wild boars and flesh. The latter are an example of a terribly mutated pig, as proven by scientists. Those creatures are rather sluggish and weak, and only a complete moron could get under its “bladed” paws, which will penetrate virtually any armor. As for boars, differ little from their relatives outside the Zone, apart from the fact that they are larger and more dangerous... Oh, and their hooves are much stronger, and can cut through fabric and human flesh effortlessly. It's enough just to jump aside and move somewhere in a couple of meters when these beasts rush at you, to avoid their fangs. Oftentimes, the meat of both wild boars and flesh is consumed, but not without being treated beforehand, to avoid radiation poisoning.

Karliks... Thanks for helping me gather information about them. Here's what I've jotted down: they mainly reside in underground complexes, most of which have previously been used for experiments on people. Apparently, Karliks are the result of such experiments. They possess supernatural strength, good speed and attack most often in groups. At the moment, only one subspecies has been discovered; smoked ones. Dirty, mutated by anomalies, they emit dangerous radiation, it is better not to go near them without a Wrenched or a Bubble in your pocket.
Mentor:\nFollow Inquisitor's orders, he still seeks your assistance. You will return to me later.
Documentation on recent orders
These documents focus exclusively on order #66, which states that prototype item 62, along with all its respective documentation, was delivered to the NIICHAZ.
Huh? Oh, it's you...
I need medical assistance.
Alright, let's take a look...
Don't be ridiculous, you're fine.
How bad is it?
That's all. You can go.
Who are you?
Oh, I work as the technician here at the checkpoint.
What do they call you?
No need for formality and ranks... not on the parade ground, at least. In case of any attack, my name would be too long to pronounce. Name's Sergey, though I prefer Seryoga.
Nice to meet you, Seryoga.
Likewise. If you need anything fixed up, just let me know.
What's the current situation?
Nothing interesting. There's a stalker village a bit to the north... Nothing but hostiles all the way up to Agroprom.
So we're stuck here and in danger of being attacked at any moment?

Nah, not too long ago, our commanding officers got us a BTR, although it's already broken down. Other than that, they've reinforced our patrols, and our helicopter's always ready to go. By the way, when you leave the checkpoint northside, stay on the road. There's a minefield on both sides.
I'll keep that in mind.
Find %s
Seryoga, a military technician, has asked you to find %s.
I do, actually. We recently left all our tools at the research complex in Yantar, which is why I can't even repair the BTR here. I need tools, basic ones. Mind helping out?
I do, actually. We recently left all our tools at the research complex in Yantar, which is why I can't even repair the BTR here. I need tools, basic ones. Mind helping out?
Thank you so much! I will give you a discount.
Find %s
Seryoga, a military technician, has asked you to find %s.
Sadly, the tools that you gave me aren't enough, as they only work for the most basic of upgrades. I need more advanced tools, they shouldn't be too rare to find. Could you find them for me?
Sadly, the tools that you gave me aren't enough, as they only work for the most basic of upgrades. I need more advanced tools, they shouldn't be too rare to find. Could you find them for me?
Much appreciated. A big “thank you” from everybody here.
Find %s
Seryoga, a military technician, has asked you to find %s.

I'm tired of rummaging around for BTR parts, it's time to get our guys equipped with some proper gear. I could use a different kind of tools... specifically, calibration tools. Can you provide me with those?

I'm tired of rummaging around for BTR parts, it's time to get our guys equipped with some proper gear. I could use a different kind of tools... specifically, calibration tools. Can you provide me with those?
Amazing. Never thought I'd see such sophisticated technology again... especially around these parts. And you won't stop me from giving you a fine discount.
Who are you?

I'm with the military, callsign “Peregrine”. We've got troops stationed here to help out with maintaining the equipment. I'm also a part-time technician, so if something breaks, it's up to me to take care of it.
What's the current situation?

To be honest with you, it's shit. I don't have the tools I need, all thanks to the outstanding supply of the higher-ups. The equipment the scientists have got here hasn't really been making it easy for us, and it's gonna need some higher quality modifications... Managed to get the old receiver here repaired, though it's still spouting a bunch of gibberish. Our guys kicked the bucket at the army warehouses a couple of years ago and it's still transmitting their voices.
Well, this is the Zone, you never know what'll happen. Best wishes.
They say you've got some interesting goods in exchange for Duty patches.

Of course! I can offer two hundred and ten 5.56 rounds for twenty patches, fifty 7.62 rounds for fifteen patches, twenty M209 underbarrel grenades for fifty patches, a scientific Freedom suit for fifty patches, a Freedom exoskeleton for sixty-five patches, and a unique SVD for a hundred patches.
I have a few patches.

Oh, great! Take your pick: two hundred and ten 5.56 rounds for twenty patches, fifty 7.62 rounds for fifteen patches, twenty M209 underbarrel grenades for fifty patches, a scientific Freedom suit for fifty patches, a Freedom exoskeleton for sixty-five patches, or a specially crafted SVD for a hundred patches!
Two hundred and ten rounds of 5.56.
Fifty 7.62 rounds.
Twenty M209 grenades should be good.
Gimme that scientific suit.
I'll take the exo.
Let me have that unique-looking SVD.
I won't take anything. I've changed my mind.
What's the current situation?

Well, the Syndicate only has one central base in the Zone, and it's right here. The path to Yantar is cut off because of the psy-installation, and crowds of zombies sometimes come out of there, along with mutants. Our guys occupy Limansk to the north, but other than that, that place has gone to shit. It's a maze full of Monolith. At the army warehouses in the east, it's all Freedom territory.
Go on.

As for any dangers, you'll see those for yourself. Keep in mind, though: when carrying out orders, you've got a job to do, and any emotions are just gonna distract you. Just put those aside. There's no room for emotion, no room for morality, only intellect and calculation. And regarding other paths, the safest route is through Limansk. There's plenty of closed space where you'll be safe from sniper fire, and you can hide from firefights as well as anomalies in shelter located around the city. The area's generally quite unpredictable, however. You can never know what exactly's around the corner.
You say that this base is central. Does that mean there are any other outposts?

There are three locations I know of that are under our control. The first one is in Zaton, at the edge of the northern marshes. The second one is being held by a detachment of ours in the southwest part of the Pripyat outskirts, and the third squadron is stationed in the Red Forest, at the bridge to Limansk, where there's also a supply agent. Other than that, you can find our squads in various parts of the Zone when they're carrying out contracts.
So anything north of Limansk is Monolith territory.

Pretty much. There's an old hospital not far from Limansk. No point in going there... The path to the Chernobyl NPP, as well as the one leading to Yantar are both cut off by psy-emissions. After you reach Limansk, stay on the southern road and make sure you've got some supplies with you.
Understood, thanks for the info.
Ah, a new face in my diner. Welcome, man.
You work as a cook here?

Yeah, guess my time at that sharashka paid off. Have some vodka to your heart's content. If you wanna have a drink, a snack, and a laugh, you found the right place. This certainly ain't no 100 Rads, but on the other hand, we ain't got wimpy knuckleheads around here, either. Our boys are square and our spoons in one piece, tee-hee.
I'll make sure to drop by.
Is there anything to do around here? I'm fucking bored.

Out of luck, aren't you, sucker? I've got a lottery of sorts for ya. Just for shits and giggles, you can fetch me some patches from other groupings and win yourself some decent gizmos... or end up with jack shit, he-he.
I'll have tried. Let's see what kind of scam you've got, big shot.
Anything else fun to do?

Do I look like a damn clown to you?... Actually, I have an idea. We can play some Russian roulette: I've got an old revolver here, and we can fire off the entire cylinder. Obviously, I'm gonna shoot into the air and not into myself. You win, you earn five patches.
Let's start.
Take out your gun.
He-he, let's go.
[pull the trigger]
[miss]
[miss]
[miss]
[miss]
[miss]
[pull the trigger]
[miss]
[miss]
[miss]
[pull the trigger]
You've got some balls! Five grand for you, big boy.
Aw, fuck! You win, here's your stuff.
Strange tunnel
Zhuchila has complained about the recklessness of local hoodlums. You have been asked to go to the railway tunnel opposite the depot and find the SVD.

Yeah, got one thing. Some asshole went into the nearby tunnel, apparently wanted to show something to his friends, and you know that tunnel; terrible place. He came back with a brand new SVD! Surely stole it from someone—fuck if I know who—but it's clear that the fucker ran into some creatures there who ended up knocking his rifle from his hands, and that was end of that. You're gonna go after that beauty, huh?

Yeah, got one thing. Some asshole went into the nearby tunnel, apparently wanted to show something to his friends, and you know that tunnel; terrible place. He came back with a brand new SVD! Surely stole it from someone—fuck if I know who—but it's clear that the fucker ran into some creatures there who ended up knocking his rifle from his hands, and that was end of that. You're gonna go after that beauty, huh?
Fucking awesome. Here, take this and have yourself a nap or something... and I'll think about who I can pass this loot off to.
Think I've caught a bullet or two.
Aw, caught a bullet? Need your wound kissed? Man, get your ass over here and ready the dough, two grand.
I think I feel better already... I'm gonna get going.
You're healthy, alright. Man, if you're here just to waste my time, I might as well take your nuts, eh?
Screw you.
Okay, you'll live. Get going, and don't forget about the brotherhood.
Need a check-up.
Ah, of course, can't even keep yourself in one piece. Let's see... Oh, and cough up a thousand, will you?
I'd rather freaking go to Kiev from here than entrust myself to you for that much money.
Hands and feet are okay... Dick is in place... Yeah, you're alright.
How bad is it?
Fuck, man, I don't understand any of this shit. Whatever, you should be better now.
Share your story, brother.
You trying to get me prosecuted or something? Whatever, get comfortable.
I'm listening.

There were times when my face was constantly on a roll of honor... I worked as a mechanical engineer at a plant and got recognized in my company as the best specialist in that profession. They awarded me prizes and certificates.
I'm guessing you wanted to get some tail?
Don't interrupt me... and do pay attention to my name.
They call you Limpid because you've got something limp down under?
Real funny guy. Anyway, I enjoyed hanging out with my guys after a long shift. Had a few too many drinks... The boss caught us, and I got fired like some stupid loser.
Life's a bitch.

The bitch that all of us have to put up with. Got a job as an ordinary locksmith and found a new friend by the name of Vitka. Barely got paid jack shit, but thankfully I earned enough to get myself a few rounds once in a while. At one time we got drunk and fucked around... don't even remember why. Anyway, I stabbed him with a screwdriver. Good thing that he didn't die right then and there. Spent a few years in maximum security while my bitch wife sold everything and ran off. When I got released, I spent all my money on drinks and ended up in the slums... Got here when the Zone came about. Here, everyone's equal. We're all outcasts. I met up with the guys at the Garbage. They found me useful as a technician and let me stay there. Best time in my life... tons of guns and vodka.
This isn't the Garbage.

Again with your damn interrupting. The big-ass Emission happened, and we hid like little girls. When that nightmare was over with, we had a meeting on where the fuck to go: the Garbage turned out to be a bad shelter from those kinds of emissions. We had to leave it for good and move through different roads in small groups to this place: the Dark Valley.
That's quite a story.
Find %s
The technician at the Garbage has asked you to find %s.

Yeah, man, of course there's work for you here. Frankly, it's embarrassing for me to ask you for help, but fuck it, no one here's getting me the stuff I need. Basically, I need some tools for rough work. If you find any, deliver 'em here, eh?

Yeah, man, of course there's work for you here. Frankly, it's embarrassing for me to ask you for help, but fuck it, no one here's getting me the stuff I need. Basically, I need some tools for rough work. If you find any, deliver 'em here, eh?
Fuck, man, you've really helped the lads. Brothers don't forget their own, so I'll give you a discount.
Find %s
The technician at the Garbage has asked you to find %s.
It doesn't feel complete... my equipment. These tools aren't enough. The others have looked around, but couldn't find a thing. What do you say? Wanna help out the brotherhood once more?
It doesn't feel complete... my equipment. These tools aren't enough. The others have looked around, but couldn't find a thing. What do you say? Wanna help out the brotherhood once more?
Respect from the heart, man! Drop by anytime and I'll help you out with these tools, you'll always be welcome here. Sorry I ain't got any beer for you.
Why is your nickname so lousy?

Look who's talking! Goddamn greenhorns, trying to act all tough... You don't handle them, they can't even hold their own dicks straight when taking a piss. If you do, they act like lousy morons, to put it in your words.
Hey, easy. Didn't mean anything by it. Just didn't know what to say.
Alright, whatever... Apology accepted. Things ain't easy when you get old and your nerves have gone to shit.
Understood. How did you get your name?

I'll tell you, if only to put an end to your yapping. My story began under the Soviet Union, before the first time I ended up in prison. I wanted a good life... Did some trade hustle, and been caught for that one day. So after I did my time, I started making new connections and selling stolen stuff. Did that for three years before I, once again, ended up in jail. Got out, but the USSR was gone... You know what the most frustrating thing was?
No. Never saw the Soviet Union at a reasonable age.
First time I ended up in prison, it was “business”... or “profiteering”, in old Soviet speech. Nowadays, anyone who's successful can end up behind bars. That place is where you feel your ass burn.
[continue...]

When I got out of my second stint, everything crashed down. No income at all, and there were loads of people around who were doing the same thing as me. When the Zone came into existence, I figured I'd go see it for myself.
[continue...]
By the way, they call me Olivius because I tend to try out the cargo people take to me firsthand. I'm keen about quality and condition.
Thanks for the history lesson. Sorry once again.
Find %s
Petrenko wants you to find %s.
The men could use some help on a mutant hunt. Are you in?
The men could use some help on a mutant hunt, will you join them? I'd like you to bring back %s.
You've earned a big “thank you” and a reward.
What is it?
I need medical assistance.
You hand over two thousand, I'll fix you up.
I don't think so.
You're fit as a fiddle. Now go, I'm busy.
How bad is it?
You're fine, the door's that way. Also, don't forget to take your medicine.
Find the %s artifact
Barman has asked you to find a %s.
I'm interested in artifacts. I give you the coordinates to a certain artifact, you bring it to me... and you also get a reward, of course. Sound good?
I need an artifact, %s.
Well done, stalker. Here is your reward.
Assassinate stalker
A stalker needs to be taken out.
I have a few takeout jobs from various stalkers and a couple of high-ranking names in Duty. You interested?
Here's your money. Just don't get carried away with killing.
Destroy the mutants
A few stalkers have set out to eliminate a group of mutants. Barman has tasked you with assisting them.
Some stalkers could use some help with taking out a few mutants. I'll give you the coordinates.
Good work. Here's the money.
Find out about the fate of the Duty squad
A squad of Dutyers was last seen in the truck cemetery, near a chemical anomaly. You have been asked to investigate their fate.

Work? I don't think you can help me... Actually, wait. My comrades and I went to the truck cemetery for a recon assignment. You know the place? A boundless area with the empty shells of Soviet vehicles. We were told that there was a squad of Freedomers somewhere in the vicinity. We never managed to find those cocksuckers... but we did find something else. Something frightening, that—that made my friends... fall to their knees and grab their heads. I have no idea why the same didn't happen to me, or why I ran away. It's a shame. Look, I certainly don't believe that my guys are still alive, as they've been gone for a couple of days... but can you at least confirm their deaths? I'll send you the coordinates via PDA; it's near some kind of chemical anomaly. Can you help me, stalker?
So they're dead? Freaking... dog tags. I'm sorry... Here's my backup gun, along with some optics for it. Thank you.
What kind of place is this?
This, my man, is the flea market. Us here sell bit by bit. Truthfully, the stuff here is pretty garbage, but we have to make do. So, you trading?
Are you the only trader here?

What? No! Other guys trade here, we just have one rule: any big deals don't happen before sunset. The guy over at the table is also a trader, and that's not counting the barman who I hope you've noticed. At night, the real life begins... the goods are completely different.
Bring the container to Sakharov
A trader at the flea market in the Garbage has offered you some courier work in the form of getting a container unlocked. The services of a technician will be required.
You look like a decent guy. I got some dirty work need doing... Can you bring this case to Sakharov?
Well done, man.
Find the %s artifact
An employer at the flea market in the Garbage has asked you to find a %s.
There's always work to do. I need an artifact. Will you go get it?
There's always work to do. I need an artifact, called %s. Will you get it?
Well done, you deserve this.
Find the %s artifact
The trader at the flea market wants me to find a %s.
You want to earn some loot looking for artifacts of the less common variety? I can offer you some good equipment.
Feel like earning some loot while looking for rare artifacts? For a %s, I can offer you some more stuff.
Ah, great work, stalker. Here, for you.
Are you familiar with this kind of container?
Where did you get that?
A flea marketer asked me to deliver it. Shall we share the stuff fifty-fifty?
You sure?
Yeah. Let's get it opened.
Actually, never mind.
Well, look here. Take anything you like.
What is this place?

Man, you're in the flea market. Stalkers around here trade whatever they can get their hands on; to my right behind the bar is our bartender and part-time hunter, although retired. Left on the couch is my colleague.
I've brought some vodka.
Oh, finally, something to drink. Is there anything particular you want?
Six mags of 9x18.
Three 5.45 mags.
Six 5.45 mags.
Some buckshot shells.
Two mags of 7.62.
Five boxes for the PKP.
The Berill suit.
I've given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I've given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I've given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I've given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I've given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I've given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I've given the signal to my comrades. You can go pick it up.
I've changed my mind.
Flight recorder

Or “black box”, as it is commonly named in media. Flight data recorders are used to record internal aircraft systems and crew conversations, usually storing data that could be useful in the event of determining the cause of a crash. In the Zone, such devices are used on all aircraft, though a proper “black box” is not always fitted. Both the military and different types of dealers may show an interest in it, and they have also proven to be sought-after wares among communities of stalkers.
Hold off the first wave
Hold off the second wave
Hold off the third wave
Return to Max
Max has asked me to defend the Barrier against hordes of zombies.

Okay, listen. Our scouts have noticed a large build-up of zombies at the Barrier. Corpses are regularly migrating because of the absence of radiation, and that's how additional zombie forces come out. We'll take any help if you're willing to offer it.
Thanks for the assistance, man. Take what I have left.
Professor, you must have something that interests you more than anything else.

Yes, I do have something. I require fresh brain tissue from a controller in order to continue conducting research in psy-emissions. In exchange, I will offer you ten first-aid kits, either scientific or army-made, a Veles detector, or three packs of anabiotics... provided you return, of course.
I'm back, and with the brain tissue as well. Here, Professor.
Splendid! Now, I can offer you ten scientific or army first-aid kits, a Veles-class detector, or three packs of anabiotics. The choice is yours.
I'll take ten scientific medkits.
Ten army medkits.
Could use the Veles.
Anabiotics would be preferred.
I've changed my mind.
Lower bridge ($$ACTION_USE$$)
Stop bridge ($$ACTION_USE$$)
Raise bridge ($$ACTION_USE$$)
Got any fresh information?
I've got information about the Swamp Doctor for seven thousand.
I'm listening.

The old man is in the Great Swamps, constantly waiting for his friend Strelok. Some stalker visited him recently, and the Doctor told him his story and something else of importance: the story of Strelok's group itself! You can find him and hear it for yourself.
Got information about some stalker looking for Strelok's group for ten grand.
I'm all ears.

This very stalker who visited the Doctor is now out looking for traces of Strelok's group. He's already been to the laboratories in Dark Valley and Yantar, and it's obvious he ain't stopping there. Judging by proven sources, he wants to break into the center of the Zone and finish what the group of stalkers never managed to carry through.
I have information that sheds light on the second shutdown of the Brain Scorcher, but only for fifteen grand.
Gimme.

This same stalker shut down the Brain Scorcher! I wonder when they're gonna try tearing up the control center instead of turning off the switch every time? There are rumors that he's currently heading to Pripyat and that he has some sort of assignment from the Doctor. I don't know if the old man wants to find his friend, or if there's something else behind it.
I can post information about the adventures of a mysterious stalker who explored the Generators for twenty-four thousand.
Pass it.

Have you ever heard about the Generators? Until recently, they were only considered a myth... but after Strelok's second campaign toward the center of the Zone, there's no doubt they're real. There have been constant disputes about what they really are, but old satellite images suggests some kind of weird infrastructure, in whose honor the entire area was named. Apparently, that's the place the Monolith carry out their orders and all important procedures regarding the territory of the Zone. So the stalker's already gone there, and I think he's serious. His intervention might have a major impact on the Zone. The leaders of a few factions have already expressed their discontent regarding this information.
Not at the moment.
Not interested.
Eliminate the target
The mercenaries have designated a target for you to get rid of.
We've always got some work. I give you coordinates, you kill a target.
Well done. Here's your money.
Collect %s
Aslan has asked you to collect %s.
Feel like hunting a few people? I'll tell you how many patches you have to strip, and you bring them to me and earn a reward.
Feel like hunting a few people down? Bring me %s and you'll be handsomely rewarded.
Well done. Here's your money.
Container
A locked container, appearing to store a number of objects.
Clean up the mutant lair
Axeman has asked you to destroy the lair of a few mutants that have been stirring up some trouble.

I need a mutant den taken care of. This place isn't too popular among stalkers, so peoples' wishes about getting here don't happen because of the damn mutants, who are out and about in the forest, the road, even on the approaches. I've got the coordinates and a reward if you can carry out a cleanup. Deal?
Thanks, maybe more people will end up coming here. Here, as a reward.
Find the %s artifact
Axeman has asked you to find and return a specific artifact on behalf of a customer.

There are a few buyers here who would be interested in a certain artifact, but since the anomalies here are poor, I prefer to entrust artifact hunting to stalkers. I'd like a %s, and you'll be rewarded, of course.
Well done, just what I need. Here.
Destroy the bandit's encampment
It is necessary to assault the bandit's encampment and destroy them.
There's a former military outpost in the vicinity that was formerly occupied by the military... and now the bandits have settled there. Can you deal with them?
Awesome, man. Here's the reward.
Cut bark ($$ACTION_USE$$)
I need medical assistance.
Right, let's take a look... and you had better shell out three thousand.
I don't have any money.
Everything's fine.
How bad is it?
Right, everything should be in order now... I hope.

Are you our guide? I will be marking the location on your PDA. You need to protect us on the way there and, once our task is accomplished, lead us back. You will receive the reward upon your return to the camp.
Is it important? We need to hurry, it'll be dangerous to stay here for too long.
Thank you, stalker, you've done a good job. Here's your reward.
Alright.
Aren't you an expert on the surrounding area? Hm, then lead the way.
Do you want something? If not, then let's not get distracted.
Thank you, fellow. Have one of our weapons.
Okay.
How are you holding up, big guy?
Hey. Getting better by the day. The main gash's been stitched, but it hurts like a motherfucker. I guess I moved around too much.
And what were you doing there?

Well, I was looking for an adventure. There was a rumor that, like, after a blowout, the tunnel went down only partially and something weird was found there. Maybe some beasts inhabited it, as they say that bodies have been found in the roundabouts... oddly, without any weapons. It's only afterward that I figured what was going on, even scooted without my bag. Good thing I retrieved it in the end. These creatures appeared, like, from thin air! Fucked up shit.
Better not stick your nose out... especially since you've got a handy skill that lets you just sit around and make cash. It's not like doctoring Soviet grans for wee wage.
You're right, I'm talking bull. Alright, see you around, friend. Still gotta sort out some ampoules here. Good hunting!
I need medical assistance.
Let's have a look, partner...
Not sure what you need, everything's fine. Drink something for psy-protection.
How bad is it?
Uh-huh... I see, keep still for a moment... Right, let's get you patched up and on the way to a recovery!
First aid: examine or ignore the signal
First aid: find the medic kit
First aid: return the medical kit to the stalker
First aid: escort the stalker
First aid: speak to the stalker
A distress signal from a stalker has come your way, stating that he requires assistance.
Kashpirovsky:\nAnyone out there? Help... I'm bleedin' out at the entrance to the railway tunnel, to the east.
Medical kit
An ordinary medical kit with bandages and drugs for countering the dangers of the Zone.
Inspect masonry ($$ACTION_USE$$)
Hey, what happened?
No time for chit-chat, my wounds could get infected... Damn snork bruised me and almost chewed off my hand! Quick, my medic bag's in that hole... without it, I'm dead.
Here's your bag.
I'm gonna down some pills first, and then bandage these wounds... Ow, shit!
Everything alright?
Yeah, yeah, I'm okay. Here, take a couple of first aid kits just in case. Let's head to the village.
Let's go.
So how do you feel?

Ugh, feels like the whole world is spinning... wonder how I even got here. Gonna lie down and have myself some ammonia, then I'll have to patch myself up. Hey, take as much money as you need from the backpack and come back in a few days if you need any help. Oh, by the way, never introduced myself... They call me Kashpirovsky. I'll be staying around here to treat local stalkers. I'd better get going, my legs aren't gonna keep up for much longer.
Destroy the mutant lair
A mutant lair needs to be destroyed in order to protect the rookies in the village and any other stalkers passing through the Cordon.

We've got a problem. The mutants have found a new spot to settle down at, and every day in the Cordon has been getting more and more dangerous with those things around... We just can't let them grow in numbers. You're gonna have to head over there and take out anything you find. Everyone here will be in your debt if you get it done. What do you say?
Great work. Thanks to you, the area will be safer for the rookies. Here's your reward.
Find a Pellicle artifact
Fanatic has asked you to find a Pellicle artifact for a rookie.

So, here's the deal. A rookie of ours went to Agroprom recently, all prepared for a merry adventure with a pistol in his right hand and a detector in his left. He scavenged some anomalous area for goodies and ended up finding an artifact. On his way back to the village some army patrol stopped him and took his artifact along with the rest of his stuff. Now he's just sitting there, absolutely devastated by what happened. It was his first artifact, and they call it a Pellicle. I would go look for it myself, but I can't leave the rookies alone. They need some protection, and they've still got a lot to learn. So, will you help him out?
Ah, you've found a Pellicle? Excellent, I think the stalker will be happy. I sure don't need him whining and sobbing all day... Gets annoying putting up with all of that. Anyway, thanks for the help.
Collect %s
Zhurov has asked you to bring %s.
The top brass has launched an unofficial program, you wanna take part? As proof, I require patches from criminals in the Zone.
The top brass has launched an unofficial program, you wanna take part? You can gather %s, don't strain yourself!
Hah, you're certainly no slouch. Nice work, here's your reward.
Find the AK-74
Zhurov has mentioned that one of his subordinates has lost his registered assault rifle somewhere in the territory of the southern checkpoint in the Cordon. It needs to be found.

Glad you asked. Quite a lousy accident happened not long ago; namely, one of the soldiers lost his rifle. He says it should be around somewhere in the vicinity of this checkpoint, but no one knows where exactly. If this all turns out to be a joke, I'll be dealing with everyone responsible personally. Try tracking it down. You probably don't have anything to do right now, but if you so much as dare stand around while looking for it, your neck is gonna be feeling sorry afterward. And only here I do not need to yell, there was a number on that rifle and his soldier fortunately wrote down, well, otherwise it's just that - a criminal is looming around.

Oh, yes, a lousy incident happened here to us, namely one of the soldiers lost his rifle. According to him, it should be somewhere in the territory of this Southern checkpoint, but where exactly - no one knows. If this is someone's joke, then I'll personally deal with him. Listen, can you try and track this shit? You're still just idle, but just try to stick around during the test, I'll choke. And only here I do not need to yell, there was a number on that rifle and his soldier fortunately wrote down, well, otherwise it's just that - a criminal is looming around.
Well done. Here's some pocket money.
Pseudodogs
Zhurov has asked you to handle a pack of pseudodogs that have been terrorizing local patrols.

Yes, got some new work for you. Clean out this square of pseudodogs; it's opposite the village, I'll mark it on your PDA. Cranky criminals and other illegals haven't driven them out, and I can't send anyone else, so I need someone to solve the problem with them alone... or they'll be gnawing our patrols at night.
Well done, soldier.
You specialize in repairs?
You seem alright, not like a smartass. Yeah, I do repairs here.
What do you mean by “alright”?

I got into a big mess, you know what I'm saying? I ended up in the Zone because of fuck-ups in my youth, and also thanks to this damn beer. My “friends” asked me to be their lookout while they were cleaning out a store, stealing a couple of cigarette boxes and a crate of beer when suddenly, the cops arrived. The guys got in a panic and started thinking of where to hide, and they threw away everything they stole... but I ran slower than everyone else, and long story short: I got caught. I didn't rat those shitheads out, so the only possible outcome was getting the crime pinned on myself, and God knows how I was going to get treated in prison after something like that. I got locked up for four years and left that place a grown man on parole. I thought to myself that I wouldn't get involved in this kind of shit anymore; that I'd find a job and rent some place, get my life in order.
What else?

Well, things haven't moved forward. Got no job, no cash, and the guys I served time with nicknamed me “bro”. The head honcho proposed that I run away to here. He noticed me because I was working my ass off at my work station like Papa Carlo, and I basically had no other choice. I would've joined the stalkers, but I didn't know anyone here; I didn't have enough money for even a hunting rifle, and if the cops would've caught me again, I'd have a fat chance of getting another parole. You know, I don't like all this "prison romanticism". These concepts of theirs are alien to me, and moreover, they're out of place here in the Zone. This isn't the same Zone as the one on the mainland... They could've been even more cruel. I dream of saving up some money and putting this godforsaken shithole in the past.
Things happen. What's your name?

I go by Baltic. Some thief made fun of my story... and I've had problems with this nickname, but I've managed to keep my dignity. And what kind of beer was in the box on that fateful evening... I don't remember.
Of course I sympathize.
Oh, screw you.
Find %s
Baltic asked me to get him %s
Bring me any kind of tools, provided that they aren't too shitty. Will you do it?
Bring me any kind of tools, provided that they aren't too shitty. Will you do it?
You're in luck! I'll jot down that I owe you a slight discount.
Find %s
Baltic asked me to get him %s
Can you help with less rubbishy tools? The whole crib is dying for some.
Can you help with less rubbishy tools? The whole crib is dying for some.
You really warm my heart, lad. Remember that your discount is being doubled.
Find %s
Baltic asked me to get him %s
I'm personally asking you to bring me some thieves' tools, unless, of course, you can't be arsed. Alright?
I'm personally asking you to bring me some thieves' tools, unless, of course, you can't be arsed. Alright?
Thank you from the bottom of my heart. This will make our guns worthy of real soldiers.
Are you the local boss?
Living like a boss, dying like a boss. What do you want?
Got any work need carrying out?
That's the right question to ask. I got some work. I haggle some stuff, and you get rich. They call me Afghan, don't ask why. Any other questions?
Creatures at the farm
Afgan worries that a pack of bloodsuckers, who were recently seen in a nearby farm, are migrating towards the factory; we need to save the camp from possible danger.

Here in the nearby farm our guys saw some bloodsuckers, maybe there are several of them, I don't know. I'm afraid that these scum will make their way to the territory of the factory and worse, dig a lair under it, and then you can kiss everyone goodbye. Such a contingency is appalling, so get them over as soon as possible. Well, can do it or find me someone else?
Here, take this artifact - my men pinched it from some dumb ass greenhorn.
Mutant slaughter
It's necessary to clean this place of mutants.
The beasts torment us, prevent them from ambushing and spreading 'suckers. I give the coordinates, you eliminate, Agreed?
Well done, you really show concern for the boys. Here.
Killing stalkers
It's necessary to take down this target.
Many bastards annoy us and totally behave insolently. In general, I give you the coordinates, and you eliminate the target. Deal?
Good, 'cause I can't sit idle, there's always suckers to deal with. There you go.
Find five dog tails
Get Sidorovich five dog tails
So, it's like this. I need five dog tails, or to be more precise, one good man - a zoologist. Interested?
Now's gonna be really stinky in here. Just be glad I'm not fining you for this stench, grrm.
Find three cat tails
Get Sidorovich three cat tails
Bring me three cat's tails, and I'll give you some money and maybe a good weapon. Deal?
Great, come here. Here's your gun and money. That's all.
Destroy the mutant lair
Sidorovich acts as an intermediary among various stalkers and military men interested in shooting mutants.
In came a request, asking to clear the area from mutants. You're game right?
Good, take some loot.
Excursion to hell
Sidorovich suggested to follow the rookies until they get experienced.

Work, eh? Well there is one thing here. You're not a snotty greenhorn, as far as I can judge by your profile in the PDA, grrh. Ugh. In short, some stupid ones piled up to me, asked me to show what, and how it is here in the Zone. Well, I sent them to Fanatic, and this devil cunningly said that they say that basic recruit training among newcomers no longer holds; well, I know that unnecessary deaths are not needed here, it does not restore its reputation, like nerve cells. So I asked them to wait at the village, until I find a suitable candidate. Well, are you leading these jerks around the neighborhood? It is necessary that they do not leave you with empty pockets and with joyful mines on their faces.
Keep these presents to you.
Find %s
Sidorovich offers unpretentious tasks asking to find parts of mutant bodies.

There's always plenty of work to do. Various private organizations or individuals are often interested in body parts of the local fauna, the focus of their activities often fluctuates... Ah-ehm, sometimes I get carried away. In short, I give you a tip, you haul it in. Ready?

There's always plenty of work to do. Various private organizations or individuals are often interested in body parts of the local fauna, the focus of their activities often fluctuates... Ah-ehm, sometimes I get carried away. In short, I give you a tip, you haul it in. Ready?
Yeah, give me this shit. Here's your loot.
I'd like to purchase some extra equipment.
What are you interested in?
Medical supplies.
Provisions.
Ammunition.
Choose.
Choose.
Choose.
I've changed my mind.
Basic training: deal with the boars
Basic training: speak to Fanatic
Basic training: get to the anomalous zone
Basic training: speak to Fanatic
Basic training: retrieve the Jellyfish artifact
Basic training: return to the village
Basic training: speak to Fanatic
Basic training: speak to Fanatic
Fanatic, one of the more experienced stalkers in the village, has decided to teach you a thing or two.
Oh, a new face? Would you like to go through some basic training?
Sure.
No, thanks.
Excellent. The biggest threat around here are the mutants. There's a herd of boars by the ravine, and you and I are going there to clear the place out. Try and keep them off me.
Phew. What now?
Well done. See if your knife's strong enough to get a few parts off of them. When you're done, let's head over to the nearest anomalous zone.
What's next?

So, this pit is full of gravitational anomalies. See the artifact over there? It's called a Jellyfish, and Jellyfishes, along with every other artifact, have both positive and negative qualities... We're quite fortunate to have found one. Here, a decent detector you can use to find artifacts. Here are a few pills, in case you manage to catch any radiation. Now, take a few bolts and throw them in front of you to check if the path's safe. Let's go. I'll cover you from here on.
Hey, I got the artifact!
Well, well... I can see you'll be an experienced stalker one day. Let's head back to the village, we'll continue your training there.
That sure was something...
Tired? Heh, don't put anything away yet. The training has just begun.
Basic training: find the stash
Basic training: speak to Fanatic
Your next task is to learn how to seek out stashes. A specific stash laid out by Fanatic is located somewhere in the rookie village.
I'm ready, what now?

Tell me, what self-respecting stalker has never marauded the secrets of another? The Zone is for everyone here. Those who manage eat, and sometimes, finding a stash is not just an achievement, but a necessity. I've hidden a backpack somewhere in the village. Try and find it.
Found it. Thanks for the artifact.
Huh... I see that with your level of perception, the Zone won't be taking you so easily. Your final lesson is about to start, take some time to prepare.
Basic training: clear out the vehicle station
Basic training: speak to Fanatic
Basic training: return to the village
Basic training: speak to Fanatic
The final task given to you by Fanatic is one of resilience. Together, you will have to eliminate the bandits residing in the vehicle station.
And what is our final task?

You'll see. As you know, the most insidious enemy of man, strangely enough, remains a man. For a long time, we've kept the vehicle station clear of all the bandits, but they keep coming back. They've been a steady threat, usually numbering from around five to seven. Let's go take care of them.
Hah, the two of us against these. We're heroes!
What you just called heroism here is commonplace for more experienced stalkers. Anyway, let's head back to the village.
It's nice that we've got a mentor like you.

Thank you, though I'd say the true leader around here is Wolf. He went on the way to the center of the Zone recently. If you want, we can try and find him later... right now, I need to rest up. Oh, and here's some intel on a route between here and the Garbage, in case you don't already have any. Good job, you are your own stalker now.
I've found a flight recorder from a helicopter wreckage.
Good find! Well done, soldier.
I found a flight recorder.
Ah, an excellent find! Perhaps we'll finally find the cause of these air raids in the marshes.
I found a flight recorder.
Oh, serious? Bring it here. Let's see what these bozos are planning.
Brother, I'm on board. I dug up the flight recorder.
Give it here, let's see what the military is planning this time.
Here. I found a flight recorder.
A military one? Great. That's actually a nice gizmo you've got there, I'll take it off your hands for some paper.
Are you interested in data from a flight recorder?
Wha—of course! Give it here.
Is this a dining room, or a bar, or something?
Well, only Duty's got a dining room in the Zone, and nobody's seen it. Welcome, man. You can call me Ganja. I've been in charge of the local grub after they put Chef in the minefield, he-he.
Mentor:\nI welcome you, warriors of the new Monolith!
Mentor:\nYou are our only hope for the future. Soon, I shall test you individually and observe whether you are worthy amongst our ranks.
Mentor:\nYou are all dismissed... except for the fighter to the far left. Come here, I have a task for you.
Clear out the parking lot from bandits
The bandits were completely fucked up and settled near Duty's post.

Well, if you can, then you can clean the parking lot from the bandits. These freaks are completely fucked up, once they allow themselves to have such neighbors. Yes, and we would take care of them, but I do not have the extra people. Are you going?
Here's your reward.
Mentor:\nWhen you have time, come visit me. Some trivial business has come up.
Can you organize a trip? There's somewhere I need to fly.
Yeah, I can take you to the Cordon, and Yantar... Wait, who are you, even? I don't offer transport for ordinary soldiers like you. Shoo.
Where do you fly to, again?
To our checkpoint in the Cordon for five thousand rubles and the base in Yantar for seven thousand.
I require a pilot.
Alright, our next flight leaves shortly. Where to?
To the checkpoint in the Cordon. %c[255,238,153,26][5000 RU]
To the base in Yantar. %c[255,238,153,26][7000 RU]
I've changed my mind.
I need a helicopter. Is this possible to organize?
It is, but we won't be using up fuel just for you. You'll have to prove that you're worth the lift.
To which places do you offer transport?

To our base in Agroprom for five thousand rubles, and the mobile lab at lake Yantar for ten thousand. We can take you to the gas station in the Darkscape, too, for three thousand, although we have no forces stationed there.
I could use a lift.
Where to, soldier?
To the military base in Agroprom. %c[255,238,153,26][5000 RU]
To the gas station in the Darkscape. %c[255,238,153,26][3000 RU]
To the mobile lab in Yantar. %c[255,238,153,26][10000 RU]

Want to help us hunt a few dangerous creatures?
Want to help us hunt various dangerous creatures? You can bring %s.
Excellent work, hunter.
Kill the pyromaniac burer
During the night, burers appear out of hot places near anomalous zones. No more should come out again.

This job is dangerous, and must be done before morning. Not far from here, in the deposit of abandoned equipment, some strange burers crawl out and terrorize local stalkers. Many are already afraid to hunt for artifacts at night and work as a whole is difficult, so you will go with a couple of other worried stalkers. Will you help them?
Well done, here's your share.
Destroy the civilian zombies
A pack of zombies came from Yantar to the Garbage, and now they stick to one of the garbage piles; you have to neutralize them

There is a good job for a hunter. You're a hunter, right? There you go! So, basically, you need to clean one of the garbage heaps from the zombies, I'll send you the coordinates on the PDA. Are you ready?
Very nice job indeed, here's what you deserve.
Escort the Dutyers
You need to cover some Duty soldiers while they are carrying out measurements of anomalies, on the instructions of scientists.
It is necessary to lead the Dutiers around the landfill, they have to fulfill some orders by some scientists. They have few people, so someone should cover their backs, are you going?
Thanks man. Here is your reward.
Are you another bandit?

Heh, no. I'm not a bandit, and I won't shoot unless you give me a good reason to. I'm a hunter by trade, but I wouldn't put it past anyone in the Zone to mistake me for a bandit. As you can see, I manage a small, cozy, and generally safe bar with the guys here... well, safe for the most part. By the way, name's Butcher.
So you're an artifact hunter?

Eh, not quite. We don't collect artifacts, we don't adhere to any common views on the Zone, and we certainly don't try to unravel its secrets. Our job is to hunt mutants, and not because they represent, in our opinion, a threat—as Duty seems to wholeheartedly believe—but because of the thrill of the hunt. Many of us were former hunters, both amateurs and professionals outside of the Zone, though many perished, since they weren't prepared for the level of... unpredictability the Zone showed them. Oh, and the trenchcoat; you might understand that such outfits are quite ideal for hunting, and the mobility they offer is certainly useful. We also try to stay out of any armed conflicts between other groups of stalkers, and the coats definitely help us stand out in that regard. On top of that, they generally serve us well as an unofficial uniform of sorts.
I see. Well, you work at a bar. Do you have anything for sale?

I do, though my stock is nothing special. Some stalkers bring mutant parts to me and I sell them. I also have a few other goods, like provisions, medicine, and equipment. And if you're up for hunting mutants for coin, I've got a few jobs.
I'll keep that in mind.
I'd like to buy intel on a few routes.
Certainly. Here's what I've got.
From the army warehouses to the Radar. %c[255,238,153,26][25000 RU]
So, do you have the money for it?
Yes, here you are.
From the Radar to the bunker below it. %c[255,238,153,26][37500 RU]
Got the dough?
Of course. Here.
From the Radar to Pripyat. %c[255,238,153,26][50000 RU]
Have you got the cash?
Here you go.
From central Pripyat to the outskirts. %c[255,238,153,26][100000 RU]
I'll need the paper, first.
Yeah, here it is.
From Pripyat to the Chernobyl NPP. %c[255,238,153,26][150000 RU]
Have you got any money with you?
Yeah, here you go.
Between the southern and northern parts of the Chernobyl NPP. %c[255,238,153,26][175000 RU]
That's a lotta money. Hope you've got it.
You bet. Here.
I don't have the money.
I've changed my mind.
I'd like to purchase some info on stashes.
Very well. I'm gonna ask you to give up five thousand. Whatever's in the stash is unknown to me.
Here.
No, thanks.
Pleasure doing business with you.
Looking for information on stashes. Got it?
Damn, how'd you know? I got info before others could even find out. Whatever, seven grand and it's all yours.
Knock yourself out.
Hey, do you have information on stashes?
Sure do. I'll part with one for six thousand.
Pleasure doin' business. There ya go.
Heard you got information on stashes.
Oh, of course! We've had all sorts of people come here. I get that you wouldn't want to wander around the Zone forever, so I'll go ahead and tell you where to go for six and a half.
Any stash information for sale?

Funny you ask. Sometimes, when stalkers around here grab a bottle, they drunkenly slip info on their stashes. Don't know what they keep in there, but what I do know is the value: seven thousand, and it's all yours.
Much appreciated.
You got any info on stashes?
I've got everything and more; if you've got the cash, that is. Got plenty of spare info from various sources. Eight thousand for this one, no less.
Right. Here are your coordinates.

Thank you very much.
Collect bark from mutated trees
Hermann has asked me to help with research on the local flora by going to the Red Forest for samples of bark.

We've always got jobs to do. Our MBU deals with the research of flora... for example, some time ago, we asked a stalker to deliver us a few types of plants to study their properties. Now we have taken an interest in the anomalous grove in the Red Forest, which is located in the middle of a Symbiont anomalous zone. We will need samples of bark from from the most twisted and mutated trees that can be found there. Will you help us?
Oh, splendid! Give them here. You may have an artifact from us.

I've been asking myself a question here, and I'd like to remember the old days and try to upgrade an SVD. Do you think you could provide me with the right tools?

You truly deserve to be my special client: the only stalker with such a large discount. Thank you!

Yeah, stalkers snatched everything and set up defenses at Yanov, those fuckers. We ain't got shit! Need some tools, man. Get me some, yeah?

Listen, I don't wanna bother you too much and all, but could you just bring one more kit here? Need a better kit to improve our shit, you know? It's hard for us here without the right upgrades, heh.
Listen, I don't wanna bother you too much and all, but could you just bring one more kit here? Need a better kit to improve our shit, you know? It's hard for us here without the right upgrades, heh.

Well, fuck me sideways! What a rarity... a real rarity. I'll give you another discount, you deserve it. Thanks, bro.

The mercenaries have put you up against a formidable challenge in order to cross the bridge.
Are you in charge here?
That I am. Name's Loki, right hand of Miklukha at this station.
An interesting name. It's like the Scandinavian deity.
That's what it is. It's what they called me in the early days, right around when the Brain Scorcher showed up. Those were crazy times.
Could you tell me more about the events after the Scorcher?

Sure. When the Scorcher was shut down, my squad launched a campaign towards the north. We went on for some time, going through different places... As the Chernobyl power plant loomed on the horizon, we decided to look for a place to set up camp and found this station while it was empty. The Zone turned to hell, and Duty appeared. The places were strange, there weren't many people, and times were wild with emissions. After calling a truce, we agreed to keep all weapons holstered and knives sheathed in this station.
And where is Duty now?

They're not here. Anyone who we didn't manage to shoot down ran off. Not long ago, a stalker by the name of Sasha appeared and helped us out considerably. The man did a lot of good things. The last piece of the puzzle he gave us was the PDA of the man who founded Duty, and according to it, he and his group were former military. Seems like he just cut off comms with the headquarters, which made local stalkers go nuts and left enemy forces confused. We kept a careful balance in this station. And thanks to the help of that stalker, we've been getting all kinds of support... from free stalkers, defectors, sympathizers, you name it. We've basically forced Duty out of here.
And where did the stalker go?
I don't know. Last I heard, he was heading towards Jupiter with some kind of fireteam. He was a good man, hopefully he's alive and kicking.
What makes the local environment dangerous?

It's full of mutants. On top of that, you've got the Monolith. Those bastards have taken over the old depot and lined the perimeter with scouts and machine guns. Other than that, some areas are crawling with zombies, such as the old village of Kopachy west of us, along with the ventilation complex and the Volkhov AA complex. Keep your eyes peeled, man.
Thanks. I'll keep that in mind.

The brotherhood wants to seize the Brain Scorcher again.

Rebirth: return to Mentor
The very day you have been waiting for has arrived. Pass through the thorns and the Monolith will give you what you have desired.
My brother. Why have you come here?
To fulfill my innermost desire.

That very desire is what keeps us remaining as a brotherhood. The Monolith has changed. Roughly speaking, the brotherhood is now supported only by a number of enthusiasts. Many former fighters of ours deserted us after the shutdown of the Brain Scorcher. Some have remained simply because they would die outside the brotherhood, but this doesn't mean they will leave sooner or later. And some, like the two of us, have stayed here because we want to build our own personal paradise, and because the technologies of the C-Consciousness allow us to stay here.
You mentioned some tests?

All in due time, my brother. Remember that your old life is coming to an end. Over time, the brotherhood has decreased in numbers but increased in fervor. What you will be experiencing here will, to any objectively normal person, seem a true horror... To begin with, I want to observe your willpower. I want you to put an end to the pseudogiant roaming around in this city, without the use of your current equipment. However you manage to accomplish the objective—with your bare hands, with the help of your fellow brothers, or with the help of any weaponry you might find—is of no matter to me. You will reveal to yourself what you are capable of for the sake of achieving your goal and what means you will end up resorting to. Now, be on your way!
Understood.
The creature is no more. I wonder why we destroy them when they may prove useful against the infidels?

The power of the C-Consciousness is not enough to keep even a handful of people in check... At this time, mutants have no place amongst our forces. Nonetheless, admirable work. Your possessions are in the blue box behind you. When you're ready for the next challenge, come.
Rebirth: follow Mentor
Rebirth: speak to Mentor
Rebirth: kill the prisoners
Rebirth: speak to Mentor
I don't know what will happen this time.
What is my next test?
Come with me.
You see these men? Mark their fate. Prove your loyalty to our cause... without the shadow of a doubt.
Very well.
Well done. These men were of Freedom, presumably scouts... We will establish why they were here. Come to me later and we shall decide what to do next.
Understood.
Rebirth: go to the Radar
Rebirth: speak to the leader of Wings
Mentor has informed you of a squad in need of assistance in the Radar.
What do you require of me?
The cossacks have spotted activity of our patrols at the Radar and the edges of Pripyat. I want you to decide on how we should deal with the matter. This will test your mental abilities.
We need to commence an attack on their nearest foothold: the Barrier. Their scouting will be hampered.
We should set out to find the rest of the reconnaissance group; they may not have moved in pairs.
In that case, you should head out at once. We shall we how you will handle this, as you have suggested yourself. We have no other soldiers to send with you, but you may have a few grenades.

You're damn right. But here's the crap that's going on according to their PDA messages. One of our recruits with whom you've done duty earlier must have snatched some five Monolith suits and given them out to saboteurs. We'll deal with the rest of those scouts by ourselves, and you should bust that spy. I've called the recruits over, they must be here, and they also know I have to have a frank talk with each, so you inquire non-intrusively what would I want with them.
Mentor:\nI have some additional work for you to be done, leftmost fighter.

Mentor:\nDone? Too bad I didn't see his face at that moment, ha-ha! Now, head to the Radar; our reconnaissance team has moved in there. The “Wings” group is waiting for you. See the commander, he will set things into motion with your help.
