Rebirth: return to the Radar
Rebirth: speak to the leader of Wings
Me and my big mouth... They gave me grenades, though.
Cease your attack and return to the Radar, our fighters need help. Speak to Griffin, he runs the Wings detachment.
Rebirth: speak to the first brother
Rebirth: speak to the second brother
Rebirth: speak to the third brother
Rebirth: speak to the fourth brother
Rebirth: share insights with Mentor
Hmm... I wonder why he does not suspect me?
You must be our new companion. Ready to take a walk and behold the former greatness of these places?
Are you part of Wings? What are we doing here?

That we are; or more precisely, what is left of them. I'm Griffin, and the other guys go by Sparrow and Pegasus. The guy with SVD is Wind. So, listen: we once had a lot of men in this place, and it was something for all the unbelievers to fear... until a stalker sabotaged the local brainwashing facility, so to speak. What started there had to be witnessed: Duty, Freedom, the loners and the military. Our best units took a punch in the gut, and as a result, everyone is dead. But no one has been able to actually control this place. I don't know what happened here, but the area's completely inhabited by all kinds of creatures, including zombies.
Go on.

We need to head into the bunker under the Brain Scorcher and assess the situation. One of the most important questions we've been asking needs to be answered today: “is it possible to restart the installation?” Are you ready?
I'm ready. Let's go.
I'm not ready yet.
Griffin:\nWe need to get into the very end of the complex. Careful, who knows what's around here...
Griffin:\nHere's the control room... it must've seen better days. Men, let's discuss our next steps.
What now?
Keep this place protected while I try to figure out what's going on here. We're probably going to have a few visitors.
Any results?

Currently, nothing. Apparently, someone's disassembled the control panel, but that's just half of it: the cooling system is bust, and I'll have to inspect it further in due time. I doubt that my strength here alone will be enough... but that's nothing you need to worry about at the moment. Listen, have you been assigned to any detachment yet?
Not really. Mentor has ordered us to respond to any incoming messages, and that's all we've got.
It seems to me that there is some potential in you. I want to express my gratitude from our whole group and give you our uniform, you deserve it.
Thank you.
I'll report back to base. See our supplier in Pripyat; he'll give you our uniform. I believe you'll be in for a pleasant surprise. By the way, fighter... I hope to see you in our ranks in the future.
I heard that I was supposed to recieve something from Wings.
Here's your Abakan.
Earned their respect? Well done, you'll be heading a long way. Here, have the company's squad uniform.
Rebirth: speak to Mentor
Rebirth: assault the laundromat
Rebirth: speak to Inquisitor
The laundromat needs to be cleared of stalkers.
What task have you got, Mentor?
You will have to seize a stalker base in the outskirts. Our brothers believe that they will be an interference in our plans and a threat to the brotherhood as a whole.
Am I going there on my own?

No, you are not. You will meet with another group of ours serving as assault troops. I give newcomers an opportunity to spend some time with two different groups so that it will be easier for them to determine their own place in the brotherhood. A shame that the third group has been taken out, though... Now, finish your task.
We did well. Mentor has told me that I am at your disposal from now on.

You really did help us! At last, Mentor has begun to recruit some stronger men. Keep your equipment in good condition and have some rest. Once you're ready, you may head to our base at the CNPP. We'll continue making preparations here, and I'll contact you once we're done.
Understood.
Head to the sarcophagus
Find all possible information about the Crystal group
Return to Inquisitor
Inquisitor has asked you to learn more about the once-legendary team of defenders of the Monolith and find some information about them.
Mentor mentioned a third detachment that was wiped out. Who did he have in mind?
The Crystal group. At one point, it was our most powerful force, tasked to protect the C-Consciousness and the sarcophagus along with all the surrounding areas.
But what happened?

As you know, some freak or a group of some freaks broke our protective barrier, the Brain Scorcher, and here came the Sunshiners, all sorts of "adventurers," even those bastards. I don't have a lot of information, as we were doing some kind of weird stuff with Preacher at the time... But I digress: the entire group is put under the net, the boys held out until the last, and if they were able to prevent the threat or not, I think you can see it yourself. By the way, you can rummage through the Sarcophagus, see if you can find some information or maybe a weapon of those times. Just don't forget to grab something for removing radiation.
Perhaps I'll go. I'm interested in the fate of the group.
Too dangerous for me.
Here, take it. Most of the information is either lost, or I do not know how to read it.
I'll tell Mentor, he'll do it later. That's really a pity.
Why did you decide to stay in the brotherhood? As I understand it, you were first zombified.

I woke up somewhere near Pripyat, with people I did not know and nothing else, as they did not remember. We were united only by uniform, and still we did not betray each other. My old life was left behind, my brother... it just so happened and nothing can be done to fix it. And I also found myself with my rifle, with twenty-two incisions on it. I don't think I'd be accepted anywhere else.
Inquisitor:\nWe're commencing the attack. Come on.

I need to dislodge the bandits from their principal place of stationing in the marshes.

This work must be done before the morning, since all those bastards are in the camp at this time. I've gathered a group of tough guys that can get even with the thugs at their home base in the fishing hamlet, Will you go with them? There's only one thing: don't ditch the guys, if someone dies, I won't forgive you.
Thank you, this is from me. You are worthy to wear this uniform.

I have tasks to clean up the marshes from all rubbish. Interested?

In short, the situation is dire. Near the tower in the southwest of the swamps settled some creature that attacks mostly at night. You have to go there now, and kill it; if you want to, of course...
Thank you from the bottom of my heart, brother.
Salutations, fellow brother. My duty is to provide technical support for our brethren in the area.

Find %s
The technician in the Yubileiny service center asked me to bring him %s.

The last set of tools that you brought here was... adequate, but why stop at what has been achieved when we can attain something even better? What we need are the best tools in the Zone. I ask of you to serve Its will one last time, my brother.

The last set of tools that you brought here was... adequate, but why stop at what has been achieved when we can attain something even better? What we need are the best tools in the Zone. I ask of you to serve Its will one last time, my brother.
Outstanding work, brother. Rest assured, I will mention your contribution to our brothers... and I promise to provide any assistance within my ability.
Hey, are you waiting for someone?

Oh, hey! Wouldn't happen to need the services of a humble guide, would you? I can take you to the rookie village in the Cordon, the... “hidden” base in the Great Swamps, and the flea market in the Garbage.
Remind me, where do your routes lead?
One thousand rubles will lead you to the rookie village in the Cordon. For twenty-five hundred, I can get you to the hidden base in the Great Swamp or the flea market in the Garbage.
Who are you?

I'm a guide, they call me Leopard. As you can see, this place is surrounded by all sorts of danger, but we've got an underground sewer network that not many know of, with the fortunate exception of yours truly. We can get you out of the city to one of two bases: the waste processing station in Zaton, or our outpost by the bridge in the Red Forest.
Remind me, where do your routes lead?
You don't have too many options: there's the waste processing station in southern Zaton and our outpost by the bridge in the Red Forest. Eight thousand and twenty-five thousand, respectively.
Are you a guide?

Yep, Navigator's the name. Can take you to a few places for a modest fee. Rookies are my customers most of the time, but I can lead any experienced stalker as well. No shame in that. I'll break it down: you pay, I get you wherever you want to go, and I return here. I can take you to one of six locations: Yantar, the Great Swamps, the army warehouses, the Garbage, the Cordon, and Jupiter.
Sorry, where can you escort me?

To the the Garbage for seven hundred, the army warehouses for one thousand, the Rookie Village in the Cordon for three thousand, Yantar for thirty-five hundred, Yanov station in Jupiter for six thousand, and the Great Swamps, also for six thousand.
Who have we got here?

You blind or something? I'm the local guide here. If you need my help, I can drop you at quite a few places, such as our outpost in the Truck Cemetery or our warehouse in Jupiter. It'll cost ya, though...
Remind me which paths you take.
The Garbage; twenty-five hundred, the truck cemetery; twenty-five hundred, the Cordon; four thousand, and Jupiter, eight thousand. All our territory, ha-ha!
Who are you?

Nice to meet you, bro. Name's Garry, and I'm a guide. Usually roam around the center of the Zone. I can take you to the Bar, Pripyat and its outskirts, the Red Forest, Zaton, and the Jupiter Underground.
Forgot. Where can you lead me?

I can offer trips to the Bar for six thousand rubles, Pripyat for three thousand and its outskirts for four thousand, the Red Forest for twenty-five hundred, the Skadovsk in Zaton for two thousand, and the Jupiter Underground for fifteen hundred.
To which places may I travel to, brother?

There are several. We have routes that lead to the Red Forest, the outskirts, and central Pripyat itself. I cannot take you to any of these locations myself, but you may go with your brothers. I don't believe you'll find that a problem.
Where can the guides take me?
To the Red Forest for six thousand rubles, the outskirts for two thousand, and Pripyat for one thousand.
Is there anywhere I may travel, brother?

Certainly. I may ask our brothers to lead you in exchange for a donation to the brotherhood. You may be taken to the outskirts of Pripyat east of here, to Jupiter to the west, and to the Red Forest located to the southwest.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
There are ways to the outskirts east of here and Jupiter to the west. Both will cost you one thousand rubles.
Hey, why are you standing there?

Well, there's no time for me to sit around; gotta be in constant sight, considering I'm the local guide. If you've got the money, there are a few places in the Swamps I can guide you to: the observation post, the water pump station, or the machine yard. I can also take a route to the rookie village in the Cordon. If you've gone completely bonkers, Agroprom is another option, and if you're in a good mood, there's also the Bar!
Can you name your routes again?

These are the routes I take: the observation outpost for three hundred rubles, the pump station and the old church both for five hundred, the machine yard for eight hundred, the rookie village in the Cordon for fifteen hundred, Agroprom for two thousand, and the Bar for four thousand.
Where do you travel to again?

To the Nuclear Power Plant for twelve thousand rubles, Pripyat for three thousand, Yanov station in Jupiter for four thousand, the Radar for eight thousand, the Jupiter Underground for just one thousand, and Zaton, via Garry, for four thousand.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
For your money, the brothers may be your guides. You may be escorted to Jupiter and central Pripyat; come to us at any time for our services.
Where can the guides take me?
To Jupiter for two thousand rubles. They may also guide you to Pripyat for a mere sum of one thousand.
To which places may I travel to, brother?
I can not escort you personally, but our brothers may show you where to go, for a fee. We've got positions set up in the Red Forest, Jupiter and Pripyat. We would be glad to assist you at any time.
Where can the guides take me?
To the outskirts of Pripyat for five thousand rubles, Jupiter for six thousand, and central Pripyat for five thousand.
You look like an interesting character.

Pathfinder Pilot at your service. There aren't many places I can take you, but it'll definitely be much faster and safer than traveling alone. I offer services to Pripyat and its outskirts via fellow guide Garry, though I can take you to Jupiter myself.
Give me your travel list again.
I can talk to Garry about guiding you to Pripyat for four thousand, as well as the outskirts for five thousand. I can lead you to Yanov station in Jupiter by myself for two thousand.
Who are you?

The local cook, I guess. I can't even make something simple like an omelet, but somehow, that's the assigned role I received in the army. I'm not a real soldier, so they put me here in Yantar. Anyway, they call me Spirit. Usually I take to drinking because it's so depressing around here. If that ain't enough, this is the main base of the scientists, meaning my officers come here for inspections from time to time, and they don't really like me drinking... Last time they were here, they poured my vodka out right before my eyes. Bastards.
Go on.

Well, I know that getting ammo around here is rough, especially when Sakharov doesn't even sell any. I can hook you up with some stuff, but only Soviet-era shit, unfortunately. I've also got a few outfits; everything I've managed to steal is mine. What do you say about trading with me for a few bottles of Cossacks? For five bottles, I can offer you six mags of 9x18, or three mags of 5.45. For ten bottles, I can share six mags of 5.45, two mags of 7.62, or five packs of 12x70 buckshot rounds. For fifteen bottles and seven thousand rubles, I can get you five box mags for the PKP, and for twenty bottles, I'll fetch you an entire Berill suit from the bins. Don't think I'm a scoundrel... it's not that bad, the lion's share goes to the guys. They've left me their equipment in a stash. I'll leave any goods between the hangars outside the bunker.
I'll consider it. Thank you.
Greetings, what do you do?

I could ask you a reasonable question in return: what's your damn business? But that's not what you wanna hear, is it? I work as a trader and a guide, and I know routes to our head base in the Dead City, along with our main outpost in Zaton.
Could you remind me where your routes lead?
Two routes, pal. Dead City for eight grand, and the Red Forest for two and a half.
Collect %s
Griffin has asked you to collect %s.

There are just too many of those goddamn fanatics. Could you wipe them out? I've got a little something that could help you out in future hunts. It's yours if you bring me twenty-five of their patches.

There are just too many of those goddamn fanatics. Could you wipe them out? I've got a little something that could help you out in future hunts. It's yours if you bring me twenty-five of their patches.
Thanks, stalker. Here's that little toy I promised you.
Find a Soul artifact
Griffin has asked you to locate and return a Soul artifact.

There's no doctor here, and we've got to survive somehow. Ordinary medical equipment just isn't enough for us, and not many of the men know how to use it properly. It's hard enough taking care of everyone around here. So, I want to ask for your help. I've heard about an artifact called the Soul, said to have an ability to heal the wounds of people. Could you find one and bring it here for us?
You actually found one? I can't believe it... Thank you, stalker! This will help the others. And don't go without your reward.
Clean out the grocery store
The mercenaries want the dogs at the nearest grocery store taken care of.

We've got another problem. There are dogs who have settled down at the grocery store, and that's no good for us. They've been barking at us nonstop, and that draws unwanted attention. I'd appreciate it if you could clear them out from that place.
Thank you, great work. Here's some money for your trouble.
Find %s
Toolkit needed %s for the mercs squad, stuck in Pripyat
Yes, I have a list of the primary things that I need. In particular, ammunition, repair kits and medicines. Can you help us?
I have a list of the top things I need. In particular, ammunition, repair kits and medicines. Now I need %s. Can you do it?
Thank you.
Climb on the roof of the water tower
Wait an hour for it to start
Go back to Ganja
Ganja asked you to climb to the roof of the water tower in order to download some entertainment data for Freedom.

Oh, dude, glad you asked... Listen, as you know, we've got an internet network around these parts, but its range is freaking terrible. Usually, we have someone climb the water tower in the bloodsucker's village and download all the good stuff for the guys, 'cause the speed there is pretty great. This one time, you could be the one going up there. I've already opened the right program on this laptop, you just have to download the stuff for us. Will you help?
Thanks, brother! If you enjoyed it, you can come back later. Getting to the top of that tower is basically a hobby of ours, heh.
Freedom laptop

A laptop shared among members of Freedom, used for recreational purposes. There are several copies of social network pages, music, various video games, movies ranging from art films to more recent blockbusters, photos of carriers of this information; and of course, videos, pictures, and drawings of pornographic nature.
Hey, what's up?
Nothing much, just lazing around. I'm Leshiy, local guide and scout.
And how's the local intelligence? I presume you've visited many places?
Indeed. I've even been in an anomaly. Entered a spatial bubble with my squad back when I was a mercenary. It's a long story. Anyway, if you need to travel somewhere, you can talk to me.
I'll keep that in mind.
So where can you lead me?
On my list is Yanov for six grand, the Cordon village for forty-five hundred, and Yantar for five grand.
Lead me somewhere.
Sure, man. Where to?
Need the money first, pal.
Here, all yours.
Got the money?
Here, keep it.
Did you bring the money?
Of course. Here.
Forgot it.
I've changed my mind.
I need medical assistance.
Huh? Right, come on over. My price is two thousand, hope you've got that much.
Nope, ain't got nothing.
Dude, you're healthier than my buddy Vitka. And he's a drug addict!
Here.
This might sting a bit. Right, you stay healthy now.
Defeat the Dutyers in the village
Mikluha knows how to discourage once and for all the Dutiers from going to the village near the path to Rostok, and in this I might be useful to him.

Oh fighter, hello! There's a delicate matter for us to handle. Do you know that the Dutiers have simply monotonously been trying to consolidate themselves in one of the villages on the way to Rostok for years? No? Basically, I know how to discourage their desire to come there once and for all and for this we must show them our tactics, so to speak. Some fresh forces just arrived there, I really do not know why they are there, but if we defeat them with half their number, imagine how much pressure it will produce? Well, are you interested?
Wonderful! Well done fighter, take this rifle. And don't even have to straighten it, the barrel is good, certainly not for open military spaces, but in some places it sure must come in handy, he he.
Find four detectors, Veles-class
Miklukha complained that the level of technical support of the group leaves much to be desired, you need to find four Veles detectors.

Oh, you're just in time; my men rarely drop by to work, but alas, I can't blame them for that. If you do not know, in the old years during Lukash, Cook and other cockeyed personalities, the level of material support of our group was negligible and from the "descendants" we got almost nothing. Now, I want to resume the tradition of gathering artifacts so to speak on people's needs, but we possess only a couple of detectors, Veles-class, and one of them was broken. I need four of these detectors, I'll pay five grands for each. Well, are you in?

Oh, you're just in time; my men rarely drop by to work, but alas, I can't blame them for that. If you do not know, in the old years during Lukash, Cook and other cockeyed personalities, the level of material support of our group was negligible and from the "descendants" we got almost nothing. Now, I want to resume the tradition of gathering artifacts so to speak on people's needs, but we possess only a couple of detectors, Veles-class, and one of them was broken. I need four of these detectors, I'll pay five grands for each. Well, are you in?
Thank you, take your money.
Unremarkable chimney top
Worn notebook
A notebook, likely owned by Strelok himself. It describes in detail how to get into an underground complex by the name of X18.
Transceiver
An old model of an army transmitter, serves to communicate and transmit information.
This box is locked.
Wings of the Monolith

A variant of the standard Monolith suit, providing a lighter load and additional comfort unlike its predecessor. Tailored to the new realities of the brotherhood, it offers enhanced protection from radiation and psi-emissions.
How are you doing?
A bit uneasy, man, but that's normal when you're in new places. I heard Mentor's calling on us for some reason?
So I've heard. What do you think about it?

I'm afraid of failing my very first test. Is it a joke to get into the Zone? I think he's worrying about me bringing the wrong artifact, or not getting any artifact at all... Gods. Gonna need some time to myself, buddy.
Hey. Have you heard that Mentor's calling us one by one?
Yeah, I've heard, but what's the use? It means he's gonna need it.
How do you feel about this place?
Not in the mood to crack into a rant. I'm preparing for my third test.
Everyone else here seems rather reclusive, brother. Would you be interested in conversing?
Why not? And how are you faring?
Everything is fine. I'm under the wing of the people who will be fulfilling my dream in the end.
And what is your dream?
If I'm going to be chatting about my dream in every one of my encounters, it becomes a purpose and not a dream. What are you here for?
I'm here mostly for the sake of money. What else can an honest stalker dream of? Anyway, you are certainly a good man, but I'd like to rest from conversations. I've heard so many things today...
Hello. How are you feeling under the Monolith?
You know, I was an experienced walker and I've had such a children's dream in the Monolith. I've accomplished half of it.
And what are you waiting for from the brotherhood?

I just want to give myself to the Monolith without any second thoughts, you understand? Nobody is waiting for me in the Great Land. Now, I need to sort out the crap from the second test. Bye, brother.
I may have found a spy. I can bring him and show you.
Go ahead.
I believe this is the first brother I've spoken to. Seems like a crazy type.
This might be the second brother I've had any conversation with. He's quite reclusive, might be hiding something.
Seems to be the third brother I've met. Too sociable. He came here for the sake of money and couldn't come up with any better excuse.
Definitely the fourth brother I've had words with. He's strange, too correct. Wanted to appease.

Man, you're a terrible investigator. Did you think I was gonna let you go just for that? Our guys have followed you and already taken care of the 'traitor'. You haven't lived up to my hopes, nor have you earned any reward whatsoever. Head to the Radar and meet up with Wings, they could use some assistance.

Safe to say you did a great job. I've sent a bunch of my guys with you, because I can't leave such a serious matter on your shoulders alone. Don't worry, they've already taken care of the messenger. Griffin sent a message, some shit's gone down at the Radar. Head there and meet up with Wings, they're gonna need your help. And take this shotgun, you've earned it. It'll come in handy.
Man, what the hell were you shooting for? You almost killed me!
And what are you here for? No bullshitting. Don't waste my time.
Okay, easy. Just passing by. Need any help? Can you answer a few questions?
I'll answer, but don't screw around.
I have a couple of questions.
Yeah? Spill it.
Where did you get this dog?

That's Lassie. A sweet little bitch... If not for her, I'd have been devoured in my sleep long ago. Cursed mutants... I hate them! Soon as you close your eyes, they start reaching for you with their nasty claws, fangs and feelers...
I see.
And those puppies; where do they come from if she's next to you all the time? Heh.
Why do you live on this garbage can?
It's the Ark! Remember that... you will, if you want to live! When a Wave starts, stay close. Here you'll have a chance to survive. No mutant will ever break in here.
What “Wave”? What are you talking about?

The creatures are watching me day and night. You do not understand... those snorks from the southern plateau have followed me right up to the Ark! I'm an experienced hunter and I know that they would not have chased the victim for so damn long. Something isn't clear... they must have a collective mind of sorts. My thoughts have been confirmed by the recent attacks on the barge by those horrors.
I guess anything can happen in the Zone, but if your estimates are correct, we're in some deep trouble.
Why do you not trust people?
Because I've been through too much.
I think I'll go.
This path is unknown
New path unlocked:
So, stalker. To go further, you need to pay five thousand, otherwise we'll drop you. Our kindness will last exactly one hour. Will you pay?
Here, corrupt officer.
Not yet.
Security chief's records

Absolutely useless records, which contain the names and pictures of all employees, who were repeatedly observed at the beginning and end of the work day. However, the dates indicate that this complex was used after the first blowout.
Production Information
There's no interesting info in this one too, nothing extraordinary happened here, apparently the employees of this plant were mainly engaged in energy issues.
Accounting book

A book containing basic information on key individuals and the material structure of the new enterprise. The lion's share of funds is earmarked, received from the state. No unusual content is located within, as it doesn't deal the matter of armaments.
PDA of a dead stalker

The battery's dead, but a note was attached under the cover, apparently duplicating the last message, just for this case: "Stalker, if you are reading this - better leave from here for good. If you came here hoping to profit, then know that there is nothing, although by the time of the discovery of this PDA, I think you understood everything yourself, I do not know if we will survive this night, I feel extremely disgusted. As if something reads my thoughts and scoffs at us. We can, terribly get tired from fatigue, we make a small stop here; I'll hide the PDA just in case, so that the mutants do not tear it up."
Destroy the enemy
A key position in the Zone must be liberated.
You know what I love the most? Surprise attacks. Unleash your rage against our opponents and you will be rewarded.
Excellent. Have your due.
Collect %s
Mentor has asked you to bring %s.
It's time to make those bastards pay. Tear off their patches and bring them to me, and I'll give you a bonus.
It's time to make thos bastards pay. Bring me %s and I'll give you a bonus.
Outstanding, brother. This is for you, from the Monolith.
Fend off the zombie assault
Zombies are entering the area from the Radar again. You need to clear them away.
Zombies are coming in from Radar. We need to face them at the south side of the city rid the area of them; any soldiers you bring with you will surely be of assistance. Will you be going?
Well done. Have a reward.
Remind me, what do you have?

This is what I've got: for five bottles, I can get you six mags of 9x18, or three mags of 5.45. For ten bottles, I can get you either six 5.45 mags, two mags of 7.62, or five packs of 12x70 buckshot. For fifteen bottles and a decent sum of seven thousand rubles, I can get you five box mags for the PKP, and for twenty bottles... I'll get you an entire Berill.
Excuse me, Garik. I need to pass through.
Is there something in that room?

Not something, someone. That guy in there is a veteran, and he can get anyone any kind of equipment, even unique stuff. He isn't accepting any visitors, though; gotta make sure you're trusted for that. Gonna need a name around here.
So, can I meet this man now?
Hm... Alright. I'll let Garik know. The name of the guy is Nimble. Head straight and then right along the corridor.
Is there something in that room?

Not something, someone. That guy in there is a veteran, and he can get anyone any kind of equipment; even unique stuff. If you want to see him, go ahead. I trust you. You can tell Garik you need to pass. Just head straight and then right down the corridor - his name is Nimble.
Can I buy extra equipment?
That's certainly possible, but nobody right now will want to sell you anything extra. You'll have to gain some trust and experience, and after that you can buy equipment wholesale.
May I purchase additional equipment from you, brother?

You may, although not at this point in time. First, I must see to it that you continue to carry the will of the Monolith towards the infidel masses. We may talk about this transaction when you gain more experience.
Find the rookie's weapon
A stalker nicknamed Fatty asked to retrieve for him his own weapon, which he dropped during a careless investigation of the abnormal substation.
What is it you wanted to offer me?

The whole factory that's in the vicinity. You know, this place here certainly isn't the nicest, but nobody here's complaining, as, frankly, the artifacts here aren't that common, and it is dangerous here for the outskirts of the Zone. But recently, rumors about the local factory started spreading, about some kind of weapon being created by the government in this place following the first Chernobyl disaster. You know the stories about the Marked One and Strelok, both almost completely having looted all of the underground complexes? There's hope for beginners here; to get something valuable and expensive without having to travel to the center of the Zone. So they've pushed forward, and I'm one of them. Bandits have followed, because there are many stalkers out here, and there's a lot of loot to grab.
So you want me come along and look for intelligence?

Yep. But you gotta help me with something, first. There's no way to survive around here without weaponry. I used to have a good shotgun... Grabbed it before I came here, but I went to the local substation not far from here, and there was a strange anomaly there... I got careless and got zapped! Fortunately, I wasn't hurt, but I freaked out and threw the weapon, then ran away here. Laugh all you want, but when you escape death narrowly... So, will you bring it to me? That's... if you want to help me with something else afterwards.
Alright, I'll go get your shotgun.
Not now.
Here's your gun.
Thanks. Take this Flash as a token of gratitude; I managed to find it in that anomaly. Prepare yourself carefully... when night comes, we'll head over to the factory.
I've already been at the factory, actually.
Oh, don't mess around. Do you have any evidence?
Yeah. Here's something I found there.
No.
And here I was hoping for something better... Thank you for clearing up the situation, it seemed dangerous there. I have nothing to repay you with... except for my shotgun. I don't need it anymore.
Don't bother me.
Explore the complex
Return
Kill the controller
Speak to Fatty
Return to the village
Tonight, Fatty is going with you to investigate the mysteries of the factory complex. Finishing the search before morning would be important.
Well, I'm ready.
Great, I just can't wait to discover all the secrets of this place. But be alert, I hope we will manage without incidents.
Hmm...

It's always like this, you know? I almost died again and you saved me... Again. But there was nothing there... Well, here's your moral, man: rely only on objective, diversified information, draw the damn parallels and don't look at the world through rose-tinted glasses. Ugh, fuck!
What's next?
Will you give me the documents? I'll keep them as a souvenir, after the attacks. I have nothing to repay you, but I can become your good friend if you want to wander with me.
Yes, here, they are useless to me.
Are you kidding me or something? I risked my life because of you, three damn times. It's better if I sell them to Barman.
Got any thoughts?
Let's check out that PDA, there might be something useful on it. I don't think they've touched it.
I think we should check out the three-story administrative building in the middle of the complex, along with the workshops.
Right? Let's scout it, maybe the stalkers left behind some traces while they were still kicking. I just don't wanna stay around here for too long... got a bad feeling about this.
None at the moment.
Find the heckler
Kill Alpha
Someone has been annoying Fatty, who now wants this person gotten rid of.
What else do you need help with?
A while ago, some dummy from the village came by and made fun of my looks. Could you pay him a little visit?
How am I going to take him out? If I'm spotted, I'm done for.

They won't know, trust me. I heard he's looking for some help with raiding the area. Just find him and tell him you're a stalker interested in some work, then lead him to a few bandits or mutants. They'll turn him into Swiss cheese. You in? I can't offer you anything personally, but anything on his corpse will be yours.
Let's do it.
Don't you find that a bit excessive? No, thanks.
Hey, nice camp you've got here. I was planning a trip and needed someone to cover my back.
Hm, do I know you? Whatever, sure, stalker. Let's go. Getting kinda bored just sitting around here anyway.
Okay, let's move.
PDA of a Crystal member

Tens of files filled with strange and incoherent information, among which can be understood that the members of this squad were from the world's best military services. They had likely supervised the experiments carried out at the nuclear power plant before and after the first emission, later becoming zombified.
PDA of a Crystal member
This device is worn out beyond repair.
PDA of a Crystal member

“The great Monolith said He was in danger; the brothers were spread out and put on alert. No one is expressing any thoughts about the situation happening outside, so today, we will have to kill or die. For the sake of the Monolith, I will do it.”
PDA of a Crystal member

Nothing remarkable is stored in the memory of the device, except for one single note, dated June 2012:\n“The last few days, the Monolith has stopped appearing in my dreams. Instead, I have begun to see episodes from the life of someone else, perhaps even mine. Is It testing my will? Is my faith in It not strong enough? Then I am ready to demonstrate to It how steadfast I am, because today, the day has come, the day when dozens, hundreds of fools try to get close to Its effulgence. Today, they shall learn the power of the guardians of the Monolith.”
PDA of a Crystal member

This appears to have belonged a member of the brotherhood, who was already engaged in several activities other than patrolling. Within is a description of a “revelatory room” in which the brains were fixed by “infidels”. The description of “mysterious visions” most likely resembles an image broadcast through a monitor. In addition to the previously unknown zombifying waves of the Brain Scorcher, the owners of this place did not hesitate to use methods of direct indoctrination in their future soldiers, through their “TV”. A method old as the world, but more effective here.
PDA of a Crystal member

“We've loaded the bodies into the truck and gave out the devices with instructions as the storm was raging. At last, we've handed the vehicle over to the brotherhood; the Monolith will tell them where It wants them. I saw the face of a man with a scar... I believe I have encountered him before at some point.”
Collect %s
A Freedomer asked me to collect %s
Man, can you gather some Duty scum patches for me? It'll help me rest easier at night.
Man, can you gather some Duty scum patches for me? It'll help me rest easier at night.
Maximum respect, bro! Hold on to this artifact.
Collect %s
A Duty member asked me to collect %s
I've got some work, alright. Why don't you go beat up a couple of anarchists? Those freaks are breathing a little too freely these days. And, as evidence, would you bring me their patches?
I've got some work, alright. Why don't you go beat up a couple of anarchists? Those freaks are breathing a little too freely these days. And, as evidence, would you bring me their patches?
Thanks, man. Here, take this artifact while no one's looking.
Collect %s
A stalker asked me to collect %s
Hi brother, won't you get some patches? I'll give you this artifact.
Hello brother, will you rip away %s? They got me already. And I'll give you this artifact.
Thank you, brother, friend and helper. Here's your artifact.
Collect %s
A bandit asked you to collect %s
Hey, boy. I have some work for you. There's too many punks out there interfering with our business. Whack some of them and return their patches to me, will you?
Hey, boy. I have some work for you. There's too many punks out there interfering with our business. Whack some of them and return their patches to me, will you? I need %s
Good job, man. My respect and artifact to you.
Find %s
A stalker has asked you to find %s.
Man, I was thinking of going on an excursion with the guys, but there's something specific we need that we can't find. You wanna help us out?
Man, I was thinking of going on an excursion with the guys, but we need %s and I can't find any. You wanna help us out?

Probably the print was made somewhere beyond the perimeter, and the fabric was subsequently moved to the territory of the Zone by local stalkers. It is an ordinary sleeping bag with a favorite character of a stalker, which will warm his body and soul on a cold night.

I heard your message. Need a guide?
Alright, let's go.
Lead the way, stalker!

Here we are.

Fatty:\nOh, thank you! Here, I'll open the door!
Fatty:\nGoddamn, what a horror... Who are they? Let's see if they've left any traces.

Fatty:\nLook, I don't think there's anything here, let's get out of here before those we end up like those poor fellows.
Fatty:\nThere should be something in that section in front of us, like in the building in the middle of the complex.

Hatchet:\nStalker, you are in the territory of the Syndicate. You won't be attacked, but we expect proper behavior of you. If you're looking for work, I may have a few things for you.
Prospector suit

The prototype of this "product" was the Sunrise suit, widespread in the stalker environment. Its main advantages can be undoubtedly attributed to the reduced weight of both the body armor and the clothes in the set (rubber in many places just cut off) and an additional container for artifacts. Unfortunately for the conduct of military operations this sample of mediocre thought is not capable, but it will help in hunting for artifacts on the initial path of becoming a stalker.
OTs-14 Groza

It is a kind of almost ordinary shabby Groza, if not for one "but". These are not traces of natural operation, but experiments conducted by some local silly tech. As a result, the wear of the barrel increased more than two times! Simply put, unlike the original, this crap will literally fall apart on your hands while using it. But don't throw it out, right?

Oh, hey, dude! You gonna show us some of that local romance? Go ahead, we'll follow your lead. We're always ready to have some fun.
Need anything? Are we doing everything right?
Look, thank you, man. We will never forget you, and if we'd ever reach the Wish Granter, then we will also make your life a sugar one. Goodbye, my friend!
Mm-hmm.
What can you tell me about Cold?
What can I say? He's earned quite a bit of respect as the current leader of our organization.
How did he earn that respect?

You see, there was some controversy regarding Lebedev, our former leader—who, by the way, I personally never met—and he didn't seem to take the opinions of the faction members into account during their reckless crusade towards the CNPP. That mercenary certainly helped us out, but in the end, it just wasn't worth it. Those who remained at the base were unable to fight back against a resurgence made by the renegades. The significance of our struggle in the swamps was reduced to zero... and the sacrifices here and on the way to the Chernobyl NPP turned out to be in vain.
It seems like the faction's resentment towards their leader at that time was justified.

There's more to it. After our troops managed to return, we had to start a long conflict to take everything back. We wouldn't be able to manage in day-to-day life without Cold. He rallied up a number of unaffiliated stalkers and got in touch with folks throughout the Garbage and the Cordon. Free stalkers helped us out, and having a charismatic leader certainly didn't hurt. Moreover, he's given an order to all fighters, without exceptions, not to leave this place. We'll take any help, but we won't continue risking the lives of our guys.
Whoever Lebedev was and what he did, you don't seem to be the same faction as you used to be.
That's your opinion, certainly has some value to it. Right now, we have no large-scale goals, nor any common ideology... Anyway, it's probably time we cut the storytelling and start the trading.
Deal.
Whose pseudodog is that?
That's Buddy, the Doctor's dog. Doctor asked Cold to keep him safe, as he's started getting a little old.
Well, by the looks of it, you wouldn't say that he needs it.
Looks can be deceiving sometimes. Pet a kind-hearted creature. Now, can I tell you about these dogs and answer your questions?
Go ahead.
Pseudodogs aren't really dogs at all, they actually originate from wolves. Duty found that out while researching them.
That's... I need to write that down. What's the request, anyway?

By virtue of my profession, I collect all sorts of stories. To the north, there's a place similar to our swamps, called Zaton. I hear there's an old crank living in the old barge, and apparently, he also has a pseudodog. Perhaps you can find out if it's true, if traveling that far won't be a problem for you.
Ok, I will check it out.
Tell me about yourself.

I used to be stationed at the Agroprom Research Institute before I got a promotion. Before the Zone came into existence, I was a car mechanic. Duty noticed my skills as a handyman after I had been around for a while, so they decided to assign me as technician here. I prefer tinkering with heavy firearms and assault weapons... hate working on snipers.
What's with the bottles? Didn't think Duty allowed for drinking.

Duty lets me drink on duty... he-he. Man, it's hard getting by without a few bottles... The work is pretty damn tedious, and boring. I wish I could go back to the Agroprom, but our base there is gone now. I don't even know if I'd be alive if they had never relocated me. They say the base was lost during an emission in 2011... Huh, looks like we've gone way off topic. Anyway, don't be shy now. Show me your toys if you need 'em fixed.
I'll see if I have anything.
Who are you?

Congratulations! With a memory like that, you'll be the next Strelok. Now listen carefully. I'm the big dog here, and you will know my name. I got here from Zaton some time ago along with my guys. We fucked the mutants out of the base and got it back up and running. Some sod set us up, pretended to be one of us and ratted me out. Had to get the fuck out.
These rooks don't even know the rules, copping the made guys like that. Whatever that douchebag's name was, I'm going to rip him a new one.
His name was Sashenka or something. And stay out of his ass. Your prick can't be any larger than my pinky, and his asshole's a metal maze.
Got it. Any tips on others in the Zone?

Simple. Don't trust anybody but our guys with skulls on their sleeves. Pretty much everyone else is hostile, remember that. Just try to figure things out for yourself. If you feel something's off, get your ass out of there.
Got it. Any safe places I can stay?

No such place as safe in the Zone, boy, but don't let this advice go to waste. North of us is the truck cemetery, and our boys there control the old checkpoint and the entrance to the army warehouses. Try not to hang around the cemetery at night, and stay away from all the old vehicles. Radiation levels there are high enough to make your counter ring down to your balls, and that's not even mentioning the creatures and anomalies. There's the Garbage to the west; total chaos over there, and there's a checkpoint to the north controlled by Duty. South of us is a forest called the Darkscape. Really wild place, you've got soldiers patrolling there from time to time and loners pissing about. Pretty big maze. Also, there are a few stalkers at the farm on the way to the Darkscape, so don't fuck around. There's a huge advantage in that forest: the road leads to the Cordon. You'll easily find our guys at the vehicle station there.
That's kind of scary.
And what did you expect, boy? No sunshine and rainbows. This is the real life.
Alright, whatever. Thanks for the help, boss.
Hey, Barman. I visited the factory in the Meadow and found some documents. Interested?

Come on, let's see what the hell you got... well, this is something only armchair generals or collectors will appreciate, you can safely bin these pieces of paper. But for solving the mystery of the plant, well done, here's some money.
Anything interesting going on in this bar?

Other than Russian roulette, you mean? I happen to be running a lottery. You need to bring me as many rare patches as possible from stalkers around the Zone, and I'll give you a random prize. If you bring ten, there's only gonna be a fifty-fifty chance of getting anything, and even then, the reward ain't gonna be that big. But if you manage to find a whooping fifty patches: o-o-o, boy! Other than that, there's a bigger demand for patches from scientists and Monolithians, so you can get even more for that; it's a complete win-win. Oh, and Freedom patches won't count, 'cause I've already got plenty.
What are you going to do with those patches?
Gonna sew myself a blanket out of them! You sure got a lot of questions, pal.
What kind of place is this?

Are you high or what? And as I know, well, dump after dump. It's actually a shitty place, filled with lots of radiation and all sorts of thugs. There's a large depot right to the right of the road, and it's better not to go there, as there's a bandit base. And I don't know anything else.
And what if Voronin finds out what you are doing here?

Don't mess with me, stalker, that could very well be life threatening for you. And where is the evidence to support your words? That's right, you don't have any. Get out of here, while we are still good.
Who are you?

I'm a local informant, and I can offer you all kinds of services. At the moment, I've got different types of information, and maps with routes to various locations. Don't ask me where I got this stuff.
Any free info can you share about the surrounding area?
Usually info is how I make a living, but since everything's quiet anyway, I can give you a bit of an insight.
I'm all ears.

Well, you're in Rostok. It's completely safe for anyone on good terms with Duty. To the west lies the Wild Territory, former western part of the Rostok factory. Rumors advise against going there at night. The best kill zones are held by the mercs, so you'll likely be getting shot from two sides. There are mutants in the lower lands, and it's better to stay at a height provided by warehouses... Although, the mercs have them covered. That's all about the Wild Territory. To the north lie the army warehouses, held by Duty's “best friend”, Freedom. There's nothing particularly interesting going on there, but it's the last shelter around for sane people. To the east is the Truck Cemetery: stock up on anti-radiation supplies and ammo if you're going there. There are a lot of mutants and sometimes the radiation is way past what even we consider to be normal. To the south is the Garbage... complete anarchy going on over there. You've got mutants and thugs, but you've also got a neat marketplace. That's all for the roundabouts, need anything else?
You mentioned something about a shelter for sane people?
Well, north of the warehouses is the Radar, an eerie place held by the Monolith. If you're heading there, best stock up on ammunition and supplies.
Thanks for the info.
Hey, man, thank you so much. The door's rather flimsy and the bloodsucker would've turned me into bones.
No problem. How did you end up in here, anyway?
I know this sounds cheesy, but I was looking for something to profit on.
Have you found anything?

You bet! I've stashed some loot in the attic, you can head up there and take it as a token of gratitude. Listen, man, if you don't have anything important on your mind, please come to me. I've got an offer.
So what are mercenaries doing here?

We're stuck, man. We can't continue forward for obvious reasons, and we can't retreat, either. On top of that, all the paths are cut off, but that could be a positive: if we return to Dushman, he's gonna tear our balls off and shove them right down our throats anyway.
What happened?

We were carrying out some kind of assignment for our client, but screwed up bad. The military eliminated most of our guys and scoured the nearby laboratory for any information. I really don't feel like chattering about this... If you're looking for work, I've got some.
You're a guide, right?

That is the case. I know a couple of paths from here thanks to a stalker... They say one of our squads wanted to get rid of him, but fortunately, he ain't mad at us for that. And, the sewer network here is quite well developed. My list goes as follows: CNPP, Pripyat, Yanov in Jupiter, the Radar, the Pripyat Underground, and Zaton, through Garry.

Gatekeeper:\nYou wanna get to Limansk? You'll have to pay. Fortunately, you won't have to pay much; only with the heads of a few chimeras hiding in that tunnel. Deal with them, and we might consider letting you through... he-he.
Gatekeeper:\nYou got 'em? Alright, we'll lower the bridge. Those flying abominations have been bothering us for who knows how long. You're welcome to trade supplies with us.

Bro, more than half of the stuff we got here is breaking apart, and I really need some tools to help out the guys. Wanna help?
Bro, more than half of the stuff we got here is breaking apart, and I really need some tools to help out the guys. Wanna help?
Oooh, yeah... That's what I'm talkin' about. Tell ya what: since you helped me out, Imma help you out with a discount.

This area is complete wilderness, but this place right here... It's a strategic point, man! To get our comrades as much firepower as possible, we're gonna need some better tools to work with. Help me out again, will ya?

This area is a complete wilderness, but this place right here... It's a strategic point, man! To get our comrades as much firepower as possible, we're gonna need some better tools to work with. Help me out again, will ya?

I'd like to purchase some extra equipment.
What are you interested in?
Medical supplies.
Provisions.
Ammunition.
Choose.

I've changed my mind.
Greetings, Sparrow.
Hello.
How are you?
I'm good, if a bit worn. Never thought I'd voluntarily end up in the Monolith.
What's your story?

I've spent lots of time in the Zone, used to dwell around the Bar. Last time I was there, I made a mistake and got wasted when all this crap started around the Radar. All the ensuing chaos got interesting. Soldiers scurrying about, Monolithians completely exhausted. I came across a bunch of guys from the Monolith, except that, by some miracle, they weren't shooting at me. I helped them out a bit, decided to go to their base, but here I already got used to it, sort of.
Why did you decide to remain?

I just can't leave the Zone behind. I've had thoughts of going elsewhere, but as I remembered the Great Land... the unemployment, the lack of prospect and any self-will. Even in a place like this, I feel more accomplished. Anyway, we'll have more time to chat later, if I survive.
Good luck.
You're Pegasus, right?
Yeah. Hey, there. Did you wanna get acquainted?
Yeah. How did you end up here?

I crossed the army blockade and ended up here, and I'd rather keep the details to myself. It's a bit personal. Besides that, the C-Consciousness is going to lead me to my dream. I've been one of the top marksmen in Wings, even though I don't particularly fancy sniper rifles myself.
What is the C-Consciousness?

You really haven't heard about them? Some might dismiss them as myth, but I know for sure that they're a group of expert scientists who somehow came into the noosphere. I managed to visit their laboratory in the north of the Zone, and let me tell you, they've got some fine technology. Holograms, advanced equipment... It's difficult to believe that it's the result of modern Ukrainian inventions combined with old Soviet technology. And, you know, I'd rather be around those who inspire confidence than some fucked-up Dutyers.
You must be Wind.
Yep.
Anything you want to share about yourself?
Nope.
Alright?...

Would you like to assist me with some research? I will pay you for your efforts.

On behalf of the scientific community, I thank you. Here is the reward, as promised.
Find two controller brain tissues
Professor Sakharov has asked for your help in finding two controller brain tissues for his research.

Hello again! For some time, I've been attempting to research psy-emissions, and I would like your assistance. No particular mental activity will be required from you, of course, but what about the brain of a controller... or, two, if you will?
Excellent, please show them! Rather unpleasant, isn't it? That's just my job, however. Thank you for the help! Oh, and here's your reward.
Clear the area
Scientists and military forces need my help in protecting the area.

Could you help us with clearing out zombified stalkers? They've been an irritation for a long time. It was dreadful prior to the recruitment of additional security. Cries, moans, the sound of nails scratching metal... Bah, no matter. If you help us, I can share one of several artifacts that stalkers have brought here with you. Will you assist us?
Excellent. Now, all that remains for us is to conduct an educational program for the idiotic masses moving into the Zone and any other psy-emissive areas.
Find the Compass artifact
Sakharov needs an artifact known as the Compass.

I, alongside the others working in this bunker, have all heard about a legendary type of artifact and its change of possession from one person to another. It's called the Compass, and it has never occurred to us to try and study it in person. Will you help assist us in finding one?
Thank you for your assistance. You may have one of our best suits. I'm sure that it will save your life, likely more than once.
Escort the scientists
It is necessary to escort a group of scientists to a certain place and ensure their safety while they conduct research, and then bring them back to the camp.

I need someone to cover our guys during routine measurements of abnormal activity. Looking back on your experience of staying in this place, I think that you are ideal for this approach. Do you agree with my statement?
Thank you, stalker. Here's your reward.
Collect the bark from spoilt trees
Sakharov asked me to help him with research on the local flora by going to the Red Forest for samples of bark.

For a long time we have been arguing about the level of abnormal and radioactive interference in the structure of vegetation, in particular the so-called Red Forest trees, but all our attempts to understand this are being broken by the insurmountable obstacles that our scientific groups had to face. You can go there and take samples of the bark of the trees there for us? They say the most mutated are standing near the Symbiont anomaly, here they are and I need those.
Thank you so much! Have this, it's what the scientific community is willing to offer.
I need batteries for a Gauss rifle.
Got any Flash artifact?
Here.
No.
Here you go.
Find the Gauss rifle
Cardan wants to acquire a Gauss rifle.

Yes, there is such a thing. I used to work here, before the first emission, we developed all kinds of weapons for military purposes, but after the blowout, we were evacuated and I I quit my job altogether. I couldn't even imagine that the work on improving our prototype might continue. Stalker, I need a gauss gun, I already held it in my hands when one of the stalkers brought it to me, but I want to try to improve it somehow. Bring it for me, and I'll start accumulating batteries for it. Well, will you help me out?

Here. Now get out before you infect me with any snork bacteria.
